The spirit of a startup at one of Germany's largest family-run businesses? A contradiction? Certainly not: At Oetker Digital we support our group companies in shaping their digital agenda and share our competence to pursue the digital future of the Oetker Group. We have a deep understanding of emerging trends and help to develop new business fields. Our ambitious goals will lead us and our group companies along exciting paths!
  
Share your passion for data and coding and become part of our team as Data Engineer.
  
These will be your tasks
  
 Your Future:  
 
 You develop, build, test and maintain architectures, such as databases and large-scale processing systems 
 You build ETL pipelines for the DWH and choose the appropriate tools 
 You gather and clean unformatted data, including from unusual sources 
 You recommend and implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality 
 You employ a variety of languages and tools to combine systems together or try to find opportunities in order to acquire new data from other systems 
 You ensure that the architecture supports the requirements of the data scientists, the stakeholders and the business 
 You model the data in a way that is meaningful for the data science team 
 You developing APIs and connectors 
 
You're offering these qualifications
  
 Your Strengths:  
 
 A degree in an IT-related field and appropriate work experience of at least 2 years 
 Experience designing data platforms that fulfill performance and scalability requirements 
 Cloud Providers (Google cloud or AWS) and distributed computing 
 Strong knowledge at least in one of these: Java, Python, Scala 
 SQL, Conceptual Database Knowledge (NoSQL, RDBMS) 
 Ideally, experience with BigData tools like Kafka, Spark and Airflow 
 Software engineering skills: testing, logs processing, CD/CI, etc. 
 Drive to solving high-level challenges and curiosity to find the right methods to solve it 
 Communication skills 
 Knowledge in German is a plus 
 
We're offering these benefits
  
 Our Promise:  
At our Berlin office, you will pursue greenfield, customer-centric projects with impact on the Oetker Group both domestically and internationally. We invite you to voice your ideas and explore new paths, in an open-minded, motivated, team-oriented environment.
  
Our core values reflect those of a family-run business, and as such we are committed to investing in you, your personal and professional development.
  
Interested? Become part of our team and shape the future of the Oetker Group!
  
 Get in touch with Yvonne Scheja:  
Oetker Digital GmbH | +49 (0)30 555 796 871 | www.oetkerdigital.com

Join a German dynamic global technology company near  Nürnberg  to build the Data & Analytics Cloud Platform for the whole company. Work in  Azure  cloud environment,  Docker ,  Kubernetes ,  Ansible ,  Terraform ,  Python  and  Java .   Company:    Our client is a multinational company with over 92,000 employees worldwide, that uses quality, technology, and innovation to shape the developments that will define the  mobility of tomorrow . In the last decade, they have shifted from offering basic components to complete systems solutions. They are present in internal combustion engines, the wheel of a high-speed train, or the drive of a machine tool. They are working on linking data from products and processes consistently with each other to provide the most innovative services to  increase energy efficiency . Being a multinational company, they offer unlimited development opportunities and employee training.   Project:    The team is building a Data & Analytics Cloud Platform for the whole corporation group so the data will be coming from the production lines, also from the client's lines. For the past couple of years, they have been designing the architecture and now will be implementing the design. So they are looking for people who are not afraid to make their hands dirty. The Platform is based in the  Azure  cloud.   Location:  Herzogenaurach (near Nürnberg), Germany.   Type of contract:   Permanent onsite position.   Recruitment process:    3 stages: First interview with Team Lead, a Technical Interview, and HR on-site interview.   International candidates are welcomed to apply. The company provides a relocation package.    As a Data Engineer you will :   Design and implement end-to-end data solutions for large-scale data architectures and applications.    Work hands-on with Big Data tools, Analytics & Semantic Frameworks in the company's Azure Cloud.    Connect data sources and ingest batch/stream data into a Data & Analytics Platform.    Implement and manage ETL processes, data transformations, data flows and service APIs according to technical guidelines, best practices, and business requirements.    Implement optimized data representations (views) and aggregations from multiple data sources.    Define and implement data ingestion, retention, lineage and access policies.    Define and implement data service API management and usage policies.   Define and use conceptual and semantic data models in data integration, transformation, and provisioning tasks, and aligning these activities with supporting Data Architects.  Requirements   Ideal Candidate:     Solid experience with one of these programming languages: Python or Java.    Experience with any Cloud services: AWS, Google Cloud or Azure (preferred).    Proficiency with SQL (e.g., MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL).    Non relational Databases (e.g., MongoDB).    Linux/Bash.    Proficient English or German.    Nice to have skills:     Working experience with Azure (Data Factory, ADLS) is highly appreciated.    Data modeling and ETL processes.    Docker, Kubernetes.    Big Data (Hadoop: Spark and Hive)    Automatization of pipelines.    ERP (SAP/ SAP-BW).    University diploma is not mandatory.   Benefits   The company welcomes candidates from all over the world    Visa sponsorship and relocation budget.    Flexible working time.    Health management plans.    Company pension.    Company sports club.   Job Type: Full-time  Experience:   SQL: 1 year (Preferred)  Cloud services (Azure, AWS or Google Cloud): 1 year (Preferred)   Language:   english (Preferred)  german (Preferred)   
 vor 30+ Tagen

Grover is the new alternative to buying or financing tech products 
 
 Grover offers a simple, monthly subscription model for the tech you love. We are the first financing company for the Circular Economy, breaking the link between ownership and usage. For a low monthly fee, private customers, as well as businesses, get access to a wide assortment of tech products at a fraction of the purchase price. We're on a mission to re-invent consumption and to make innovative technology accessible to everyone. As a member of the CE100 group of leading companies in the Circular Economy worldwide, we are at the forefront of reducing waste and establishing a more sustainable way of using products for both consumers and the environment. 
 
To date, we have raised more than €100 million in equity and debt from investors including Samsung, Commerzbank, and Global Founders Capital. LinkedIn ranks Grover as one of the Top 10 hottest startups to work for in Germany in 2019.  
   
We are now looking for a great  Data Engineer  to support our  Engineering  team in Berlin. You will drive the innovation of our data engineering processes, interfacing with our frontend and backend engineers! Every decision at Grover is data-driven, you will be working on the systems and tools that define our analytical power.  
    
As our new Data Engineer, you will :  
 
  
Create machine-learning algorithms, to help data scientists improve Grover's platform  
Build robust distributed systems to process large scale data streams into useful applications  
Engineer fast, real-time data pipelines to process data from multiple sources to make fast and accurate decisions  
Implement risk monitoring systems to improve tracking and mitigation of several risks including fraud  
Work closely with data scientists and collaborate with back-end, front-end engineers to build products for gathering timely insights about our customers.  
Create monitoring systems to track the quality of data and the health of our systems   
    
You love :  
 
  
Having ownership. You easily share new ideas and implement them, and take responsibility for your actions  
Helping others. Sharing knowledge with your colleagues is on top of your priorities!  
Fast-paced startups. You love to adapt to different situations, and you know when to iterate fast or with higher quality.
  Our product - you believe in our vision, and are willing to give your best to build the future of Grover!   
    
We are looking for a passionate Data Engineer with :  
   
3 + years' experience as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced / start-up company    
Proficiency in Python, and knowledge of SQL    
Hands-on experience with cloud database platforms, ideally Amazon Redshift and AWS suite.    
Understanding of distributed systems, working in a similar tech stack. We are using ELK, Kafka, Redis, and Zookeeper.    
Experience with Async programming (Asyncio, tornado, twisted, Trio) is a plus    
Experience working with REST APIs and/or SOAP is a plus    
    
What we offer you  
  
Fun tech projects and ownership  
A laptop of your choice (Windows or Mac)   
Entrepreneurial responsibility and flat-hierarchies    
Ownership of your work    
Modern, spacious office located in central Berlin    
Open-minded variety of nationalities    
German Classes in the office    
A fun workplace    
Smunch    
Fresh Fruit & Drinks    
Team Events    
  
  
About us  
 
Grover is the European market leader in technology rentals, bringing the access economy to the consumer electronics market. If you want to work with a dedicated team at a purpose-driven, fast-growing company, increasing consumer welfare around the world, join us now. At Grover, we value entrepreneurship, intelligence, and speed in everything we do. We're a team of over 90 creative and motivated minds, from more than 31 countries – which means our aims, beliefs, and ways of working are influenced by many different perspectives. We care for individuality and for team spirit, act courageously and communicate openly. In our HQ, in Berlin Mitte, there is plenty of space for fun, collaboration, and rethinking the way the world does, uses and values things.   
 Grover   -  
 vor 6 Monaten

Prinect bildet den Workflow unserer Kunden bei der Produktion von Printmedien-Produkten ab und integriert die traditionell getrennten Bereiche Management, Vorstufe, Druck und Weiterverarbeitung. Prinect automatisiert den gesamten Produktionsprozess und ist der zentrale Datenpool für alle relevanten Daten. Das System wird schrittweise in eine Cloudlösung überführt. Am Standort Kiel arbeiten im Entwicklungsbereich Prinect 140 Mitarbeiter/innen mit den Methoden agiler Softwareentwicklung an innovativen Projekten zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Software-Workflow-Lösung. 
 
Ihre Aufgaben: 
  Entwerfen, Umsetzen, Testen und Dokumentieren von Datawarehouse-Lösungen, Datenplattformen und ETL-Scripten zur Bereitstellung von BI-Lösungen

That’s us  
 
TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data driven and execution oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists and organizers. We have productized our insights solution as “Pulse” for various of our clients, including Miele, FrieslandCampina, BMW, Volkswagen, Lufthansa, Postbank, Deutsche Bahn, L’Oreal, and Telefónica. 
  
That’s you  
 
We drive innovation in marketing and data science and believe that magic happens when data science meets imagination. Great brands, however, will to also create great business value by supporting a company’s actions. Together with our consultants, developers, and designers we help to build those products and drive the digital transformation of our clients. Therefore, we create data science solutions to predict the future of consumer behavior, to find the best media budget allocation, to guide brand management operations and to provide insights and management solutions on how to drive business. If you are also keen to shape the future of data driven management solutions and break down boundaries in marketing and data science, you are welcome in our data science team. 
  
Your tasks will include  
 
 Implementing and maintaining production-level, robust data analytics scripts in R or Python 
 Shape the technical infrastructure, testing, and monitoring 
 Define and put into action development, quality assurance, and support processes 
 Keep code quality high through pair programming, code reviews, code analytics 
 Crunching and describing data sets containing important consumer/customer insights on structured and unstructured data 
 Integrate against external API, databases, and our reporting platform 
 Optimize performance of algorithms and script execution 
 Promote the spirit of Data Science development  
   
  
There is a match if…  
 
… your profile is completed by demonstrated skills in a relevant programming language, e.g. R or Python, for a minimum of 1-2 years 
 
… you have a solid understanding of coding techniques, robust code, and error handling 
 
… you have worked with DBMS like MongoDB or Elasticsearch 
 
… you have experience in connecting with external RESTful APIs 
 
…. you possess a deep understanding of statistical modelling (particularly regression analysis and probability theory), practical machine learning and data mining 
 
…. you hold a Master’s Degree in Econometrics/Mathematics/Statistics/Engineering with at least 1-2 years’ working experience 
 
… you like working in an agile environment and being responsible for the technical design, implementation, maintenance, monitoring and automated testing of software 
 
… you are a team player who likes to share, discuss and work on ideas / tasks with your colleagues  
  
  
That’s in it for you  
 
 A startup atmosphere within an economically solid company right in the center of Berlin – with rooftop access and a stunning view 
 Flexible, family-friendly working hours 
 Work with a like-minded team 
 Get an opportunity to try out new technologies 
 Projects & clients that will make you feel proud to work for

 We want to hire you!  
 
OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hard working, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.

Unsere Big Data Lösung ist Branchen unabhängig und wird bereits von Konzernen für Competitive Intelligence, Knowledge Management, Enterprise Search, Technology Monitoring sowie Patentanalysen eingesetzt. 
  
Ihre Aufgabe…  
 
beinhalten u.a. die kontinuierliche Verfolgung wissenschaftlicher Entwicklungen zur Erweiterung im Bereich von Big Data, Verbesserung des Funktionsumfanges unserer Produkte und Anpassung an die Kundenanforderungen. 
 
Evaluierung geeigneter Verfahren und Algorithmen sowie Weiterentwicklung an die Anforderungen in unserem Unternehmen. Sie nehmen prototypische Implementierungen dieser Algorithmen vor und begleiten die Softwareentwickler bei der produktiven Umsetzung. 
  
Ihr Profil  
 
Sie haben einen Hochschulabschluss , Master oder Promotion, in Informatik, Mathematik, Physik, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang. 
 
Sie verfügen über Erfahrung in Big Data Analytics mit Fokus auf strukturierten Daten. 
 
Sie können moderne Techniken aus den Bereichen Data Mining, maschinelles Lernen und statistischer Analyse anwenden. 
 
Während Ihrer akademischen Laufbahn oder beruflichen Tätigkeit hatten Sie Kontakt mit den Methoden zur Datensuche, Datenbereinigung, Offline- und Online-Datenanalyse, sowie Datenvisualisierungsmethoden. 
 
Weiterhin verfügen Sie über gute Erfahrungen in der Softwareentwicklung im beschriebenen Kontext, da Sie auch die Realisierung der SW- Teams kontrollieren. 
 
Gute Englischkenntnisse. 
  
Die Karriereperspektive:
   Sie werden Teil eines interdisziplinären, hoch motivierten und jungen Teams. Sie arbeiten mit hochtalentierten Experten aus dem Bereich Big Data zusammen und schaffen Lösungen die aktuell für Konzerne große Bedeutung haben. 
 
Wir bieten die Chance forschungsnah und doch produktorientiert an der nächsten Generation der IT-Innovation mitzuarbeiten.  
  
 
Offenheit und Freundlichkeit sowie ein sehr angenehmes und modernes Arbeitsumfeld. 
 
Karrierechancen in unserem dynamischen Unternehmen sind überdurchschnittlich.

Dienstsitz:  Nähe Frankfurt /M – Gelnhausen oder Berlin 
  
Anfang :  sofort , Festeinstellung

           Unternehmensprofil  
   Produkt, Kunde und Unternehmen - Digitalisierung hat für Porsche drei Dimensionen. Um diese jeweils mit dem unternehmenstypischen Anspruch meistern zu können, rückt die IT bei Porsche immer mehr in den Fokus. Der Bereich wächst stark und Digitalisierungs-Spezialisten sind momentan gefragter denn je. Alleine in den vergangenen fünf Jahren hat sich die Anzahl der Mitarbeiter im Bereich IT bei Porsche verdoppelt. Denn das Ziel steht fest: Porsche soll zum führenden Anbieter für digitale Mobilitätslösungen im automobilen Premiumsegment werden. 
 Das Fahrzeug wird dabei als ultimatives mobiles Endgerät verstanden. Aber die Digitalisierung betrifft längst nicht nur das Fahrzeug und die digitalen Services rund um das Produkt, sondern insbesondere auch die Interaktion mit den Kunden. Und nicht zu vergessen: Mit Industrie 4.0, Big Data und Internet of Things bekommt auch die Digitalisierung der Unternehmensprozesse eine ganz neue Qualität. Aktuell werden bei Porsche mehr als 350 IT-Projekte unterschiedlicher Größe bearbeitet. 
Gründe für einen Einstieg in die IT bei Porsche gibt es viele: Das attraktive Arbeitsumfeld mit flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodellen, flachen Hierarchien und vielfältigen Angeboten zur Work-Life-Balance, zum Beispiel. Vor allem aber die packenden und herausfordernden Aufgaben, die in den unterschiedlichsten Projekten auf Sie warten.

Deine Leidenschaft sind Daten und das Erkennen von Mustern und Zusammenhängen in großen, inhomogenen Datensätzen ist dein Ding? 
 
Innovative und datengetriebene Lösungen – von der Datenpipeline bis zum fertigen Datenprodukt – sind deine Passion und trotz deiner technischen Affinität ist der Kundenkontakt für dich das A und O im Joballtag? 
 
Data Engineering ist dein Ding im Bereich Data Science? 
 
      Als Berater im Data Science Umfeld begegnest du bei uns immer wieder neuen Herausforderungen, welche dir die Gelegenheit bieten, über dich hinauszuwachsen. Neben dem Design und der Entwicklung von Datenarchitekturen, Datenpipelines und Vorhersagemodellen (insbesondere auch in der Cloud), wirst du die Möglichkeit haben, dich in die verschiedenen Fachrichtungen unserer Kunden einzuarbeiten. Von der Informatik über die Physik und die Biostatistik bis hin zu den Sozialwissenschaften, vereinen wir deine Branchenexpertise mit deinen technischen Fähigkeiten und machen dich zum Datenspezialisten! 
 
Als Data Engineer nimmst du neben den grundlegenden Aufgaben im Data Science Bereich natürlich noch eine weitere wichtige Rolle in den Projekten ein. Voraussetzung neben deinem spezifischen Wissen sind natürlich auch die allgemeinen Anforderungen im Data Science Umfeld, die dich aber nicht zum zittern bringen können. 
 
       Dein Profil als Data Engineer…  
 
 Du hast das methodische und technische Know-how, um Data Lakes aufzubauen (z.B. AWS S3, Spark, AWS Athena) 
 Mit SQL und NoSQL Datenbanken sowie der zugehörigen Datenmodellierung kennst du dich einwandfrei aus 
 Anwendungen in der Cloud hast du bereits entwickelt (idealerweise AWS) 
 Du beherrschst Containertechnologien, wie Docker, Kubernetes, KubeFlow 
 Im Umgang mit modernen Workflow Management Tools, wie Airflow oder AWS Glue bist du bereits sehr sicher 
 
        Dann bieten wir Dir…  
 
 Eine offene Kultur für Herz und Hirn, flache Hierarchien und agile Arbeitsweise 
 Viel Raum für gute Ideen, spannende Projekte und Lernen, Lernen, Lernen 
 Ein sympathisches Team mit vielen motivierten, kreativen und klugen Köpfen 
 Möglichkeit der Arbeit aus dem Homeoffice, dem Büro deiner Wahl oder auch beim Kunden vor Ort 
 … und vieles mehr!

Job Description 
 
lastminute.com is looking for a Marketing Data Engineer. 
The job requires close collaboration across our international sites and with respective analytics, engineering and product teams, which could require some travel between locations. 
You will build the next generation of data tools to enable us to take full advantage of data using programming languages. You will help non-technical marketers craft better campaigns, programs, and customer experiences that effectively leverage software and data by using SQL and technical interfaces that marketing has inhouse, or with agencies and service providers between them. 
The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate advanced analytical skills, extensive database knowledge, and business and marketing acumen alongside proficiency with several programming languages and tooling (Python, SQL - mySQL, vertica -, Tableau, Spotfire, CRM) and experience working with big sets of data.   
Key Responsibilities    
Understand the current Marketing setup and tasks in a marketing department.  
Manage implementation process of marketing automation systems, guiding cross-departmental teams through training, integration, and initiative build out.  
Build and deliver robust data tables respecting marketing and IT needs.  
Create and maintain ETL processes and business reports, get actionable insights with data analysis and own data quality for the data pipelines created.  
Implement measures to achieve good SQL performance.  
Implement technical improvements to drive efficiency and insights across sales, marketing and cross-departmental initiatives.  
Participate in vendor selection processes for new technical solutions, including the development of business and technical requirements.  
Complete entire data analysis life cycle: procuring and cleaning raw data;identifying key insights; creating reports displaying those insights; communicate with internal stakeholders.  
Serve data models as a product to the entire marketing, including database design, implementation and debugging.  
Work closely with IT, engineering, BI and product teams.  
Pragmatic, result and business oriented approach.  
Good communication skills.   
 
 Qualifications 
  
Essential    
2-3 years in programming experience (CS degree or similar or relevant experience)  
Marketing knowledge and experience in the industry.  
Familiar with marketing tools and platforms (Google Analytics, BigQuery, DoubleClick).  
Experience and expert knowledge with relational and high availability Databases (mysql, postgresql, vertica, BigQuery) and Python in real world projects.  
Comfortable with Python scripting to transform/cleanup sets of data and implement ETL processes.  
Familiar with distributed version control (GIT) and developer tooling (Intellij, database).  
Knowledge of database schema normalisation and optimisation.  
Data processing knowledge to ingest/export/process real world data: python, unix tools, pandas, Spark.  
Ability to optimize SQL for performance and understand how to tune SQL based on query plans.  
Experience using statistical methods (for instance, normalisation, moving average, regression, forecasting, outlier removal, clustering methods)  
Good knowledge of English language    
Desirable    
Knowledge/experience on the travel industry appreciated.  
Good knowledge of other languages are a plus    
Abilities/qualities    
Good team player and communicator and soft skills dealing with other departments  
Ability to clearly and professionally communicate with other members of the team and other departments and to provide reasoned and data-driven arguments in favour of design decisions  
Practical and hands-on problem solving skills

Wir bei sevDesk

We are real.digital: Several thousand dealers and millions of products make our multi-channel portal one of the largest marketplaces in Germany. Our work is characterised by a dynamic corporate culture, with a start-up mentality and the opportunities offered by a large corporation in the background. We combine knowledge and many years of experience in e-commerce with flat hierarchies and a highly motivated team. Whether as an intern or an executive: We take every idea seriously, because we want to work together in shaping the future of e-commerce!  
Day-by-day, our development team of about 100 experts pursues the goal of developing the best products and optimising the shopping experience. Our domains operate along the customer journey to ensure that we always keep an eye on the customers’ needs and can deal with new challenges promptly. Whether AdTec, After Sales, Checkout & Accounting, or Logistics, we drive developments forward and have great freedom regarding technical aspects. Details regarding the challenges of the respective domains can be found here https://www.real-digital.de/team/tech/.

A dynamic environment with a start-up mentality, no superfluous red tape and hierarchy, as well as plenty of courage and trust to break new ground  
A central, modern office in the heart of Cologne

Always up-to-date – you receive four days of special leave and a budget of €1,300 per year to attend relevant fairs and conferences

Über uns
     Unsere Vision ist der „Persönliche Coach“ für jeden Mitarbeiter, der ihn begleitet und messbar voran bringt.  
CoachHub verbindet moderne Technologie und New Work Konzepte, um etwas bisher Undenkbares zu ermöglichen – Personalisiertes Coaching für Mitarbeiter aller Karrierestufen! Gemeinsam bauen wir die größte Coaching Plattform Europas und darüber hinaus. Zu unseren Kunden zählen die renommiertesten Tech-Firmen und globale Milliardenkonzerne. Wir coachen weltweit auf 6 Kontinenten in über 28 Sprachen. CoachHub wird unterstützt durch Europas führende Tech-Investoren, u.a. Holtzbrinck Ventures, Partech and Speedinvest. 
     Deine Aufgaben
    Als Data Engineer bist Du Teil unseres BI-Teams, das unsere neue Dateninfrastruktur entwirft, modelliert und implementiert. 
  
Du entwirfst und modellierst unser Data Warehouse für Betriebs- und Anwendungsdatenschichten  
Du erstellst Datenpipelines, die mit Primär- und Drittsystemen integriert werden, um Geschäftsprozesse und Produkte voranzutreiben  
Du automatisierst manuelle Prozesse, die die Infrastruktur für eine höhere Skalierbarkeit und die Optimierung der Datenbereitstellung darstellen  
Du baust und entwickelst effiziente und zuverlässige ETL-Pipelines, die Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen mit Python, SQL und AWS in unser neues Data Warehouse bringen  
Du stellst die Datenqualität und Systemstabilität sicher  
     Dein Profil  
    3+ Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datentechnik, idealerweise in einer Startup-Umgebung  
Starke Erfolgsgeschichte bei Business Intelligence-Lösungen, Aufbau und Skalierung von Data Warehouses und Datenmodellierung  
Erfahrung im Entwurf und Bau von Datenleitungen  
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis und Arbeitserfahrung beim Aufbau skalierbarer serviceorientierter Architekturen  
Erfahrung mit diesen Technologien: Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, AWS Redshift, PostgreSQL, Python, Jenkins, AWS  
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierungsplattformen wie Google Data Studio, Tableau, Power BI, etc.  
Erfahrung mit Continuous Integration und Deployment in AWS  
Arbeitserfahrung und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in mündlichem und schriftlichem Englisch  
Universitätsabschluss in Informatik, Ingenieurwesen, Mathematik oder Physik  
      Warum wir?  
    Die einmalige Chance, unser stark wachsendes Start-Up von Anfang an mitzugestalten  
Vielfältige Lern- und Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten, sowie eine steile Lernkurve  
Deinen persönlichen Business-Coach  
Direkte Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Gründern und Geschäftsführern  
Spaß im höchst motivierten und humorvollem Team  
Regelmäßige Team Events  
Viel Freiheit, Eigenverantwortung & flexible Arbeitszeiten  
Zentraler Standort in Berlin   
Sollten wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung. Idealerweise sendest du uns bereits deine Kündigungsfrist sowie deine Gehaltsvorstellungen mit.  
 
 Bei Rückfragen steht dir Christiane, unsere Human Resources Managerin, gerne unter folgender Telefonnummer 030/88789193. Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennen zulernen!  
 
 Hinweis zum Datenschutz: Indem du deine Bewerbung abschickst, erklärst du dich damit einverstanden, dass wir deine Daten im Rahmen des Auswahlprozesses verarbeiten. Deine Daten werden nicht an Dritte weitergegeben und du kannst die Löschung deiner Daten jederzeit anfordern.

-----------
 DESCRIPTION
 -----------
  
Clue helps everyone who menstruates to understand their bodies—and to be empowered by that knowledge. Our vision is to enable women and people with cycles to live in tune with their biology, not in spite of it.
  
Founded by Ida Tin, Clue is a VC-­backed startup ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fhelloclue.com%2Farticles%2Fabout-clue%2Fclue-raises-20-million-in-series-b-funding ) based in Berlin helping over 10 million people each month get insights into their reproductive health via our Android ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fplay.google.com%2Fstore%2Fapps%2Fdetails%3Fid%3Dcom.clue.android ) and iOS ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fitunes.apple.com%2Fus%2Fapp%2Fclue-period-ovulation-tracker%2Fid657189652 ) apps. We collaborate with world-leading universities and institutes to advance female health research ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fhelloclue.com%2Farticles%2Fabout-clue%2Fscientific-research-at-clue ) with our dataset, and deliver essential education about health, periods, and sex via our website, helloclue.com ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fhelloclue.com%2F ).
  
To learn more about how Clue works behind the scenes, read our engineering blog, Bleeding edge ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2Fbleeding-edge ).
  
----
 ROLE
 ----
  
 
 Provide Data Scientists and Business Analysts a consistent way to access data, and support their work from research to production. 
 Be part of a team responsible for the design, development and maintenance of data pipelines. 
 Own relevant parts of new features, while working closely with Data Scientists and Backend Engineers. 
 Collaborate with Backend and Operations Engineers to ensure systems reliability. 
 You'd help hire and build a data engineering team. 
 
------------
 REQUIREMENTS
 ------------
  
 
 Experience in either a JVM language or Python, with a willingness to learn another language if necessary. 
 Experience of using a pub/sub or streaming platform such as Kafka or Amazon Kinesis Data Streams. 
 Practical experience with one or more streaming engines such as Spark, Flink or similar. 
 Experience with analytical databases like Redshift. 
 Experience with creating aggregated data schemas that allow for efficient and flexible use by analysts. 
 Experience processing and storing large and unstructured data for analytical purposes. 
 Good knowledge of unit and integration testing techniques. 
 A grasp of the importance of writing good documentation—for developers, as well as for other colleagues. 
 Hands on, with a willingness to dive into data quality problems and find root causes. 
 Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a plus. 
 
--------
 BENEFITS
 --------
  
We believe personal growth is essential for professional growth which is why we offer all the standard benefits, plus some that are uniquely Clue.
  
 
 Care for your body and mind with free weekly yoga and personal trainer sessions, a free on-site therapist and low-cost massages in the office 
 Learn and grow with a personal education budget and subsidized German lessons at work 
 Work your way in our child-friendly and dog-friendly office. We'll help with relocation if you're not already in Berlin. 
 Five weeks of paid vacation each year, a competitive salary and the option to join the company pension plan. 
 
Clue is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect, where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and team members. Our users are global and multicultural—and we want our team to reflect this. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team and be responsible for the design, development and maintenance of our data architecture. In this role, you will be responsible for keeping our database infrastructure up to date and running smoothly to support the needs of our growing company. 
 
We are a fast growing social business. At Good Hood GmbH we help people to feel at home in their neighbourhood again. With our platforms nebenan.de in Germany, mesvoisins.fr in France, vicinimiei.it in Italy and tienes-sal.es in Spain we enable people to connect and support each other in daily life so strangers become neighbours. We believe that by revitalising neighbourhoods and encouraging exchange, shared activities and mutual assistance among neighbours we can contribute to a positive change in society towards a more humane, sustainable and secure living environment that offers a higher quality of life for everyone. 
 
Data science and business intelligence play a critical role in the success of our platform. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to support us in bringing our data to the next level. 
 
What you will do 
 
 Be responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of our data architecture, connecting multiple data sources and ensuring reliability. 
 Develop automation, monitoring and alert systems to increase the stability of our data structures. 
 Prepare, clean and format datasets for processing and analysis by our Business Intelligence team. 
 Regularly identify and implement ways to improve data quality and reliability. 
 Support critical operational and analytical applications for our internal business operations 
 Work directly with Product and Systems Owners to deliver data products in a collaborative environment. 
 Help maintain documentation and share learnings with team members. 
  Your profile 
 
 You have a passion for data and reliability. 
 You have a proven track record in the implementation and scaling of data systems, including the implementation of a data warehouse. 
 Proven experience with development and scripting in python, perl, ruby or any of the major languages to build robust data pipelines and dynamic systems. 
 Proven ability to leverage multiple tools and programming languages to analyze and manipulate data sets from disparate data sources and build innovative solutions. 
 Proven knowledge of AWS including services in their compute, storage, databases, management tools, and analytics portfolio. 
 A passion for data, and an understanding of how to work with large data sets. 
 Willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies under minimum guidance 
 You thrive in a startup environment and feel best working in a small, cross-functional team where you can roll up your sleeves and be hands on. 
 You believe in the mission of our company and feel passionate about building strong neighborhoods across Europe. 
 Fluent in English, German is a bonus! 
  What we offer 
 
 A meaningful job! We create a great product with real social impact. 
 Growth potential and opportunities in this role and the company. 
 Collaboration in a great, experienced and international team that exchanges ideas and learns from each other. 
 Insight into the entire work process of our startup as well as the nebenan.de foundation. 
 A workplace in Berlin-Kreuzberg, a cheerful team, with regular events such as team breakfast, lunch roulette, brown bag talks. 
 Free fitness classes, such as yoga and back courses. 
 A strength-based development culture (we work with the Gallup StrengthsFinder). 
 A company pension plan. 
 Flexible working hours and the possibility to sometimes work from home. 
  Diversity means collaboration – at nebenan.de we are happy about every dimension of diversity that enriches our team. We live equal opportunities and support them. 
 
If we’ve captured your interest, apply now and let us know why you’re the perfect fit for the job! 
 
Please send your application in one PDF file, including CV, relevant certificates and references to Aline: jobs(at)nebenan.de

Ihr Arbeitsumfeld 
 Das Data:Lab ist ein zukunftsorientierter, datengetriebener Innovations-Hot Spot für alle Marken, Märkte und Geschäftsbereiche des Volkswagen Konzerns. Unser Ziel ist es durch den Einsatz von Advanced Analytics und Machine Learning Methoden einen Mehrwert aus Daten zu schaffen. Als Data Engineer werden Sie zur Implementierung der Datenpipeline-Architektur im Kontext der Datenanalyse und KI beitragen. 
   Ihre Aufgaben 
    Unterstützen der Data Scientist Teams bei Themen rund um die Verarbeitung von Daten und ETL
 
  Anwenden von Artichtekturen und Technologien gemäß aktuellstem Entwicklungsstandes bei der Implementierung der Datenpipeline-Workflows (z.B. mit RDBMS, NoSQL, Hadoop, Kafka)
 
  Automatisiertes Bereitstellen von Data Science Umgebungen auf Multi-Cloud Plattformen
 
  Selbstständiges Verbessern von CI/CD Lösungen auf Multi-Cloud Plattformen
 
  Umsetzen innovativer Lösungen zur Datenverarbeitung auf dem Gebiet der Künstlichen Intelligenz    
   Ihre Qualifikationen 
    Abgeschlossenes Fach-/Hochschulstudium (mindestens Masterstudium) einer fachlich relevanten Spezialisierung und mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Softwareentwickler
 
  Fortgeschrittene Arbeitserfahrung mit SQL und relationalen Datenbanken
 
  Umfangreiche Kenntnisse über Datenverarbeitung und ETL, um Datenpipeline Workflows innerhalb verschiedener Projekte und Use Cases umsetzen zu können
 
  Grundkenntnisse über Technologien aus mindestens drei der folgenden Gebiete: NoSQL (z.B.: Elasticserach, MongoDB, Cassandra), Message Queues (z.B. Kafka, RabbitMQ) und Big Data (z.B. Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, HBase)
 
  Grundkenntnisse und Arbeitserfahrung mit Lösungen moderner Softwareentwicklung basierend auf Microservices und Containerisierung (z.B. Docker)
 
  Praktische Erfahrung mit CI/CD Tools (z.B.: Jenkins, GitLab CI, Travis CI, Atlassian Stack, git,..), insbesondere im Bereich der ETL-Automatisierung
 
  Praktische Erfahrung mit Linux und Skriptsprachen (mindestens Python und Bash)
 
  Praktische Erfahrung mit mindestens einem der großen Cloudanbieter (AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud), sowie mit automatisierten Deployments in der Cloud
 
  Optional Erfahrung mit Openshift oder Kubernetes
 
  Optional Kenntnisse über Technologien im Bereich Datenanalyse, Visual Analytics, Machine Learning, Text Mining und Suche

Ihre Aufgaben
  
 
 Verantwortung: Sie gestalten und steuern alle Prozesse rund um die Speicherung, Pflege, Aufbereitung und Weitergabe von Betriebsdaten der Telematikinfrastruktur. 
 Koordination: Sie wählen für die Analyseziele passende Datenbank-Systeme und -Komponenten aus und stellen Installation, Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung sicher. Dabei entwickeln sie eine Daten-Infrastruktur, die Quellen über verschiedene Schnittstellen integriert und Aktualität und Konsistenz der Daten sichert. 
 Aufgabe: In Ihren Aufgaben kommunizieren Sie aktiv mit Bedarfsträgern und Datenlieferanten, um die Datenstrukturen beständig weiter zu entwickeln. 
 Herausforderung: Durch geeignete Kombination von Komponenten vereinen Sie Anforderungen unterschiedlicher Datentypen relationaler Strukturen und Messdaten. 
 Auswertung: Mit der von Ihnen geschaffenen Daten-Infrastruktur bilden Sie die Grundlage für das Reporting und weitere Analysen. 
 
Ihr Profil
  
 
 Ausbildung: Sie sind Informatiker (m/w/d) oder haben eine vergleichbare akademische Ausbildung. 
 Know-how: Sie bringen mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Konzeption und dem Management von SQL- und NoSQL-Datenbanksystemen mit, z.B. MS-SQL, mySQL, Elastic Search, MongoDB. 
 Kenntisse: Sie haben Kenntnisse zur Datenanalyse und zur Entwicklung von Algorithmen und im Programmieren, z.B. SQL, Python. 
 Fähigkeiten: Ihnen sind Schnittstellenformate und -technologien wie XML, SOAP, REST, JSON und der Aufbau von Data-Pipelines vertraut. 
 Arbeitsweise: Sie haben eine hohe Auffassungsgabe und sind in der Lage, schnell Zusammenhänge und Strukturen zu erkennen. 
 Persönlichkeit: Sie sind Teamplayer und verfügen über sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.

The GROHE Sense solution brings water security to the home – aiming to reduce the number of and the consequential costs of a water leak. The products & services concepts for this connected solution as well as the business models have been developed by the digital innovations unit, a start-up within GROHE with the ambition to lead in digital water. We enable sustainable water enjoyment by managing water intelligently. To continue innovating in this area, we are currently searching for our Head Office in Düsseldorf a Junior (Big) Data Engineer.  
We are looking for a Junior (Big) Data Engineer to join our growing team. The hire will be responsible for expanding our data pipeline architecture. The ideal candidate has first experience building data pipelines and in data wrangling who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from scratch. The Data Engineer will support our data scientist on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data architecture. Must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of the business and product teams.   
Your main responsibilities    
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture  
Assemble large, complex datasets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements  
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements  
Automating manual processes  
Optimizing data ingestion and delivery  
Re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability  
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data using SQL and ‘big data’ technologies  
Build analytic tools that use the data pipeline to provide actionable insights  
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems    
Your profile    
Master’s degree in computer science, engineering or equivalent  
Min. one year of academic or professional experience dealing with large datasets  
Experience with relational and non-relational databases (SQL, NoSQL, MySQL, Presto, etc.)  
Solid knowledge of Python and at least 1 OOP (Java, C or C++)  
First experience with AWS / Azure services and cloud architecture  
Familiarity with modern development concepts, particularly continuous integration (CI/CD)  
Expertise in Linux systems  
Experience with containers (e.g. Docker) and distributed computing (e.g. Spark) is a plus  
Instinct for automation  
A proactive and problem-solving mindset  
English speaking (must) and German speaking (plus)    
We offer    
A very dynamic environment with global exposure  
An international team of experts to inspire you and to learn from  
Work location in an attractive, international city  
Company restaurant and free use of the in-house gym  
Free parking and good transport links (public transport)   
Upon an invite to an interview, candidates will be exposed to an inbox test. You will work in the GROHE corporate headquarter in Düsseldorf, in our digital innovation 'start-up' team. Using principles from 'the lean start-up/the start-up way', a book we recommend you to read, we focus on fast continuous improvement learning and implementing rapid change adapting to new opportunities on our exciting journey.  
We are looking forward to your application. For queries and further information, please do not hesitate to contact us.  
Grohe AG 
Mrs. Lara Küster 
Feldmühleplatz 15 
40545 Düsseldorf   
 Grohe AG   -  
 vor 30+ Tagen

At Blue Yonder, a JDA company, we employ state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms to generate hundreds of millions of microdecisions for large retail enterprises every day. Full automation allows us to shape supply chains and set selling prices such that customers never face empty shelves, less groceries go to waste, and fashion stores no longer end up with heaps of surplus clothes at the end of season. 
 
  Our retail products run on the Blue Yonder platform that provides all necessary services to deliver best decisions to our customers. Our platform defines standard APIs for customer payload data exchange and offers the computational punch for our data scientists, scaling from a single CPU to hundreds of cores and terabytes of RAM within seconds. All this happens for all customers on the same shared infrastructure hosted on Microsoft Azure. 
 
  As one of a few companies worldwide, we have solved the tough problem of bringing data science to production while keeping costs and operations at bay. Now part of the JDA family, we continue to relentlessly drive innovation to pursue our vision of the autonomous supply chain. On the way, we have solved, and will solve plenty of interesting and challenging problems, and we would love to have  you  on board for tha t journey. 
 
   What to expect
    Work together with our machine learning experts, engineers and project managers to advance our data science products
  Design and develop data-intensive distributed systems in Python with focus on data engineering
  Use technologies such as Pandas and Dask, as well as modern NewSQL query engines like Presto or Apache Impala in the cloud
  Support on-boarding new customers with your expertise in organizational or data-intensive tasks
  Work in an agile team with emphasis on quality, testability and automation
      Your experience
    In-depth knowledge of Python, Pandas and its open-source ecosystem
  Expertise in working with SQL
  Interest in data handling with modern tools such as Apache Airflow, Apache Parquet, Dask and Presto
  Knowledge in techniques for data modeling, storage and access
  Passion for software craftsmanship and interest in modern methods such as Kanban, TDD and pair programming
     Everyday, our teams work enthusiastically with our customers on innovative AI-based solutions and sophisticated optimization for the retail industry. Working with us means you can look forward to coworkers who use creativity to collectively develop ideas and appreciate each other’s expertise.
  We live for pushing artificial intelligence forward and scalable solutions. Joining our team means you can look forward to working with our people on realising creative ideas and see how they operate in the resulting solutions. Mutual respect, friendly relationships and results-oriented work are an important part of our environment. We strive to be a family-friendly business and are open to modern working structures.
  We believe that the individuality and diversity of our employees make a decisive contribution to our success. Our hiring process is based on qualifications and career profile. We welcome applications from all motivated candidates, regardless of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, origin or religion.     
 JDA Software   -

For challenging and varied projects, we are looking for you in your new role as DATA ENGINEER at the FEV headquarter in Aachen. In your highly specialized and dynamic team you will work on future technologies in the field of automotive and contribute to research and development activities. One of your exciting tasks will be the management of huge amounts of data collected in real road traffic. You can contribute to the success of these projects by making different types of data readable, analyzable and therefore valuable.   
As a data engineer at FEV, it will be your task to pre-process and manage massive data streams. Applying Big Data methods and technologies for data analytics and data visualization makes you conduct to the development of future automotive solutions.  
You will contribute to very interesting agile projects by taking over responsibility and you will encourage the team spirit with your experience in the areas of requirement engineering, system concepts, implementation and roll-out.  
You standardize data sources for developing innovative solutions and connect structured with unstructured data by applying Cloud Storage and Services.  
By bringing experts from different areas together, you will achieve unique customer experiences and solutions.   
 
  You have a university degree in data engineering, computer science, informatics, mathematics, physics or engineering.  
You have already gained several years of experience in the field of data engineering.  
You gained very good knowledge in the areas of Data Engineering, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Hadoop eco systems, Cloud Computing etc. which will help you to cope with the challenges of a data engineer.  
You have already acquired good knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, Scala, Java, Matlab etc. and you are proficient in SQL.  
First hands-on experience in the field of visualization, agile methods and knowledge with the corresponding tools complete your profile.  
Business proficient English is required. German is a plus.  
First experience in dealing with customers, as well as high communication and presentation skills is beneficial.  
With a high level of flexibility, creativity, willingness and commitment, combined with team spirit and a way of autonomous working, you can contribute to the successful establishment of a new team in the field of data engineering.   
 FEV Europe GmbH   -  
 vor 25 Tagen

Entry as   
Employee         
Working Model   
Full time         
Location   
Hamburg         
Start   
By arrangement          
Our mission     
There are millions of trucks on the road every day. The shocking truth: Every third truck runs empty. You can imagine the negative impact on our environment, our roads and the logistics market.  
With Cargonexx, we want to solve this problem and therefore, have developed a platform that automatically avoids empty capacities through state-of-the-art technologies such as AI and Machine Learning.  
We want to have you on our mission to build an environmentally friendly and digitized logistics industry. Therefore, we are currently looking for a  Data Engineer  (m/f/d).       
Why this role exists       
The trucking industry needs to become more efficient  
To spot all inefficient areas, you need to make them visible first. We believe this can only happen if you ground yourself and all your decisions in data. Unfortunately, this is something our sector is not doing very well, and we want experts like you aboard to pioneer this area.   
Our platform is getting better and better.  
One of the reasons is because we value data like gold. If you treat data well, it will always reveal areas where you can improve your business. As we see change as a great opportunity, we use every insight we can get to make our platform even better.   
The market is constantly increasing its complexity.  
Complexity contains the seed for disruption (Think about it). Every disruptive product solved a complex problem. Data helps us solve complex problems, to see coherences and to make decisions that help thousands of businesses.        
What yo can do      
As part of the Data Intelligence Team, you will build and maintain the ETL processes connecting our Data lake, Data warehouse, CRM-Tool, etc.  
You will be responsible for connecting further new data sources into our data infrastructure  
You will be responsible for securing a high availability for our data infrastructure  
You will work closely with our development team to connect new features into our data infrastructure  
You are responsible for ensuring data quality and processing and combine or clean up data        
What you should be capable of      
You have at least a degree in informatics or mathematics or a comparable qualification, good to very good  
You have already gained initial practical experience in building and modifying databases drafting and implementing new data models  
You have advanced programming skills and can read and edit codes  
You have already gained experience with AWS, S3, MySQL or other databases  
You speak fluent English (any other language, e.g. German, is welcome, but not a must)  
You have a high understanding of digital business models and are experienced or highly attracted by the fast-paced start-up atmosphere        
Our culture     
We live a culture of appreciation and empowerment. Therefore it is important to us that our employees have the best conditions to be happy, productive and healthy at work. We not only want to promote a work-life balance but also work towards a holistic work-life integration and therefore we offer our employees maximum flexibility.   
Here you will meet a team of like-minded people who roll up their sleeves, have fun at work and make a real difference  
We support flexible working hours as best we can, offer a mobility program (e.g. HVV Ticket) and ensure that our employees' work-life balance is right  
Learning on the job, regular training and workshops are something we do as a matter of course  
It is important to us that the success we have achieved together is celebrated and therefore, we organize events for the team after important phases  
With us, you have the unique opportunity to experience and shape the growth of a highly ambitious company     
  
Cargonexx is committed to diversity and equal opportunities - regardless of gender identity, race, descent, religion, gender, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, disability or age. All applications are welcome and will always be processed with the utmost care and in compliance with data protection regulations.      
 Cargonexx GmbH   -  
 vor 4 Tagen

These tasks are waiting for you: 
 
 
Serviceware is a leading provider of software solutions that enable the digitization of service processes. We have been listed on the stock market since 2018 and follow an ambitious growth strategy. 
 
In 2019, we started an innovation center focusing on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). Serviceware AI was born! Using this initiative, we pursue three ideas: 
  
We seek to create an environment that allows fast experimentation and iteration. Few heavy processes. Freedom for creative ideas. Like a start-up within a publicly-traded company.  
We aim at developing ML features that are ready for production. Proof of concepts are nice, but we want our work to impact reality soon. This is why we envision software engineering and data science to be tightly linked right from the start.  
We like to take advantage of the recent progress in ML. Leverage the latest research insights. Cooperate with the technical university. Invest time in evaluating new technologies.  
 
By now, we began to work on the first use cases related to Serviceware’s key expertise: service management. But which questions do we deal with in service management? 
 
In short, that’s everything that improves today’s customer service by the analysis of data. For instance: 
  
How can we help businesses answering customer questions more quickly and reliably? (Advanced language models?)  
How can we enable companies to predict the costs of their customer services more accurately? (Time series analysis?)  
How can we support employees in finding knowledge needed for customer service more easily? (Neural networks?)  
 
To build services that address these questions, we are hiring a (Senior) Big Data Engineer. And this is how your job looks like: 
  
You design, implement, and maintain big data services that facilitate the use of AI within our service management platform.
  You develop data models that provide access to large data sets.
  You keep track of data quality and continuously improve it.
  You contribute to the proper selection of technologies allowing us to build scalable software.
  You work in an agile software development team in Darmstadt.
  You intensively cooperate with our data scientists to make the most of our data. 
    
         What you bring on the table: 
   
Deep interest in solving the challenges of using big data.
  Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science or a related field.
  Sound knowledge of common big data technologies (such as Kubernetes, Hive, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop or Google Cloud Tools).
  Strong experience with Python, Java or a similar programming language.
  Profound knowledge of distributed algorithms and data structures.
  Willingness to contribute to continuous knowledge exchange and team learning.
  Effective communication skills (fluent in English).  
       Your future with us:   
You will work on a modern and extensible tech stack (Python, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, Spacy, Docker, Git, Postgres, Flask, Azure DevOps, SonarQube, …).
  You will possess a high degree of autonomy to pursue new ideas.
  You will have many options to improve your skills (e.g., by attending our coding conventions, conferences, or knowledge sharing session).
  You will have a true impact on our service management platform affecting thousands of individuals every day.
  You will work in our new office centrally located in the beautiful city of Darmstadt.
  You will be part of our international team of ML enthusiasts who are not only great at work but also love cooking, eating cake, going to the gym, watching Netflix, and playing the guitar.
    How to Apply   
Are you thrilled to join the team?! We can’t wait to read your application. Please consider the following guidelines when applying at Serviceware AI:   
Applications are possible in English as well as in German.  
We expect you to write a short cover letter that tells us why you like to work at Serviceware AI. (Please don’t use stock cover letters. We’d love to hear why you like this particular job.)  
While we enjoy reading about your experiences, please keep your CV focused on the main points. We are not looking for CVs with more than two to three pages.        
 Serviceware SE   -  
 vor 30+ Tagen

jobtitle: Senior Data Engineer for Group DWH Product (f/m/x)
description:
International business requires an international corporate philosophy. Are you open to new ideas and do you value cultural diversity? At Raiffeisen Bank International, we are pleased to have more than 16 million customers in 13 CEE countries. And our journey continues – with exciting new issues for us to tackle such as digitalisation and changing customer needs. Join us on our journey. 
  Senior Data Engineer for Group DWH Product (f/m/x)  
 In order to strengthen our delivery capability and business know-how, we are looking for an ambitious and service-oriented data engineer in the agile-shaped IT Delivery Unit Group DWH Product. Our unit is responsible for product development and product innovations of the group wide business intelligence platform which is the basis for bank steering (CFO, CRO) as well as compliance and marketing. 
Although based in Vienna, the Business Analyst has a strong CEE focus and interaction with clients in 15 countries. Intercultural skills and customer orientation are key success factors. 
 
 Your responsibilities: 
  Detailed designing and implementation of the data warehouse components such as:
  data warehouse architecture, logical and physical structures and objects 
 data integration processes (ETL/ELT) architecture and solutions, 
 business intelligence reports/models and/or 
 other business intelligence or data warehouse solutions 
   Estimation of efforts and timelines 
 Implement prototypes in close cooperation with end-user 
 Ensure stability, performance and cost-efficiency of the developed components in design- and implementation phase 
 Create logical and physical database models 
 Unit testing of the developed components 
 Proper quality assurance of the developed components 
 Know-how transfer to other team members regarding the developed components 
 Refactoring and optimization of existing components 
 Root cause analysis of a defect/incident/problem (acc. ITIL) within the defined response time 
 Resolution of defect/incident/problem (acc. ITIL) root cause within the defined response time 
 Create and maintain technical documentation 
 Create, maintain and/or contribute to solution requirements documentation 
 Support the release to production, e.g. by being at office during the Go-Live (mostly in the evening hours) or acts as an on-call contact 
 Gain necessary business know-how for optimal implementation and 2nd level support 
 Investigate new technologies and provide proposals for their application 
 2nd Level Support for developed components 
 Manage product releases and small projects 
 Coach/Perform trainings for other team members within his/her technological knowledge domains 
 Implement or customize reusable components, libraries, artefacts or tools 
 Maintain know-how and update knowledge transfer platforms (e.g. Wiki’s, information portals) 
 Continually update technical knowledge and skills by attending inhouse and/or external courses, reading manuals and accessing new applications. 
 
 
 Your qualification: 
  Minimum 5 years working experience with development of:
  conceptual, logical and physical design of database structures and objects, 
 conceptual, logical and physical design of data warehouse structures and objects, 
 data integration processes and packages (ETL/ELT), 
 business intelligence reports/models and/or 
 other business intelligence or data warehouse solutions 
   Minimum 5 years of working experience with DBMS such as Oracle Database or PostgreSQL 
 Minimum 5 years of working experience with ETL/ELT software such as ODI, Talend or other 
 Experience with meta-data driven ETL/ELT frameworks 
 Experience in performing analysis and design for Data Management and Data Driven projects 
 Excellent know-how in data warehouse design/techniques/approaches (Inmon, Kimball) 
 Excellent analytical skills 
 Practical experience and ability to teach or instruct co-workers 
 Excellent knowledge of SQL

Support HeidelbergCement on its way to become a leader in the digitalized concrete, cement and aggregates business! 
 
We are looking for a passionate  Data Engineer (f/m/d)  whose primary focus will be to uncover the ‘Big Data’ ecosystems of our Digital solutions. 
 
The HeidelbergCement Digital Transformation Office (DTO) is set to create the best digital experience for our customers. We want to create real value for our customers by applying cutting-edge technologies to our core business. We know that our success has to start with the customer. Our customers increasingly want to engage with us through non-traditional, digital channels and we want to provide them with a great experience. This requires a deep understanding of their needs and a relentless drive to meet them. Our benchmark is not our competition; our benchmarks are Domino and Uber. 
 
The primary focus for our analytics team is to draw value from data. To ensure that we can harvest this value, we also need a stream of steady and reliable data. As a Data Engineer (f/m/d), you will be responsible for building data pipelines by retrieving, loading and transforming data related to our digital products, to prepare the data for analysis and visualization. Your work will have a direct impact on understanding the health and usage of our digital applications. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of Behavioral Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Software Developers, and Product Owners. You will report directly to the Global Head of UX and Analytics. 
 
 
  Your next challenge    
Develop, construct, test and maintain architectures  
Align architecture with business requirements  
Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality  
Design database solutions for data retrieval, data migration and ELT (extract, load, transform) requirements.  
Develop data pipelines to ensure a steady and reliable flow of analytics data from various sources.  
Understand the requirements of data analysis, visualizations and machine learning models.  
Archive the data for long-term storage and generate outputs that serve as a basis for analytics reports and predictive models.  
Help data scientists in packaging their codes for reusability and support code integration and maintenance by building the appropriate infrastructure.  
Pull together multiple data sources to draw a realistic picture of our digital products’ data ecosystems and ways to explore further.  
Design conceptual and logical data workflows and automated processes that will support our analytics.   
  
Your profile    
Bachelor's / Master's degree in Computer Science, Natural Science, or equivalent discipline.  
A minimum of 8 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Data Architect.  
Experience with programming languages such as Python, R Programming, and Java.  
Strong knowledge of data mining and ELT techniques with stream processing systems like Apache Spark, or Apache Kafka.  
Experience with automated data workflows with engines such as Apache Airflow or Oozie.  
In-depth understanding of relational and non-relational database systems (SQL, NoSQL).  
Strong familiarity with distributed systems, and workloads spread among cluster services, such as Azure and AWS.  
Proven analytical skills coupled with problem-solving attitude.  
Experience in Visualization (Tableau, plotly) and Machine Learning (scikit-learn) methods will be considered a plus.  
Excellent written communication and presentation skills.  
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.  
Excited to work in an international team with global impact.  
A software engineer at heart with a background around data and its uses in data science.  
Fluent in English.

Data Engineer – DACH Region   
We know that there are all kinds of data engineers, with varying levels of knowledge about different platforms and data sources. At InterWorks, we're more interested in candidates who are hard-working, smart and love what they do. We care more about overall database and analytical skills rather than experience with a certain database platform. Whether you have worked primarily in SQL Server, Oracle, or something else, we only ask that you have a strong understanding of SQL as a whole and can apply your skills within our fast paced and agile approach.  
While some companies may hide their data engineers away in some dungeon, data engineers at InterWorks are social, friendly creatures. That is why being able to communicate with clients day in and day out is especially valuable. Our data consultants must be able to work closely with users in order to understand their needs and help them best as possible.  
You might find it difficult to do the same thing each day. At InterWorks, Data Engineers can expect to work on diverse projects ranging from a few days to several months. Many of these projects include solving business problems using data from some of the largest organizations in the world. Projects also include working with disparate data sources (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, DB2, Excel, Hadoop, Text files, etc.) to unify client data, creating ETL processes based on client needs and managing client expectations.  
InterWorks prides itself on having an exciting work environment, with a unique (and downright nerdy) company culture. InterWorks employees are some of the most intelligent and friendly people you will ever meet – they are the primary reason for the success of InterWorks. To keep this ball rolling, we have built a knowledge sharing culture around here where everybody gets involved. Tech talks and blogs, unlimited access to online courses and opportunities to top notch tech conferences constantly refine our skillsets. Joining the InterWorks team as a Data Engineer means joining a family and our family is growing faster than ever.   
Skills and Requirements   
Here are some basic requirements that we look for in our Data engineers:   
Required:    
Excellent SQL skills  
Strong ETL skills, experience with SSIS, Alteryx, Pentaho, Informatica, or similar toolsets  
Experience in designing data warehouse  
Coding skills (PHP, Java, C#, or others)  
Excellent verbal and written communication skills  
Business acumen  
Easily adaptable and flexible to changing situations  
Passion for delivering compelling solutions that exceed client expectations  
Fluent German and English  
Hunger for variety accompanied by willingness to travel     
  
Highly Desired:    
Background in Software Engineering  
Having built data pipelines yourself Experience with Visual Analytics tools (Tableau, QlikView, Cognos, or similar)  
Experience with Web technologies (HTML, CSS, JS)    
About InterWorks   
Founded on twenty years of business consulting experience and a culture of complete client satisfaction, InterWorks delivers the absolute best in full-spectrum IT and data solutions. From servers and storage to development and visualization, our talented team leverages industry-leading technology to help organizations across the globe build a foundation for sustained success.   
About the Business Intelligence Team   
At InterWorks, we're obsessed with data at every level. This obsession has led us to assemble the most talented team of data superheroes the world has ever seen. Wielding tools like Tableau Software and Alteryx, our Business Intelligence Team has helped Fortune 500 companies, government organizations and respected universities alike get further, faster and smarter with their data strategy.

Für den weiteren Ausbau des Berliner Standorts eines etablierten AI-Unternehmens mit insgesamt ca. 200 Kollegen und Sitz am Hackeschen Markt, wird derzeit ein Data Engineer* gesucht.              
Das Unternehmen, das sehr stark im Bereich Forschung&Entwicklung engagiert ist, hat ein hochkomplexes Analysetool entwickelt, das Lösungen mittels Big Data Analyse, NLP u.ä. in den Gebieten Technologie-Monitoring, kompetitiver Intelligenz, Enterprise Search und Wissensmanagement ermöglicht.              
Gesucht wird hier ein erfahrener Mitarbeiter*, der einen guten Überblick über die laufenden Entwicklungen der Forschung behält, um das Produkt stetig erweitern und verbessern zu können. Dazu zählt auch, passende Algorithmen und Verfahren zu prüfen, welche dann von Ihnen weiterentwickelt und entsprechend angepasst werden. In Zusammenarbeit mit den Kunden pflegen Sie die Wissensdatenbank und erweitern damit das Knowledge Management. Hierfür untersuchen Sie interne & externe Datenquellen im Bezug auf Relevanz, Qualität und Umfang. Neue Datenpunkte integrieren Sie in die bereits bestehende Infrastruktur. Im Idealfall verfügen Sie über ein breites Portfolio im Bezug auf moderne Methoden zur Datensuche, Datenbereinigung und –modellierung, sowie deren Qualitätssicherung. Auch die Fähigkeit, komplexe Zusammenhänge, Muster und Cluster zu erkennen ist hier klar von Vorteil.              
Die Softwareteams (Teamgröße ca. 4-6 Personen), die sich selbst nach Scrum organisieren, arbeiten derzeit u.a. mit React, Angular 7, Javascript, Java, C#, Python oder auch .NET Core und legen insgesamt sehr viel Wert auf Clean Code Development und einen insgesamt sehr sauberen, nachhaltigen Code. Das Berliner Team von derzeit 30 Personen sitzt in einem sehr schönen, modernen und top ausgestatteten Büro in Mitte und wird durch ein 7-köpfiges UI/UX Team unterstützt.              
Insgesamt arbeiten gut 200 Mitarbeiter im Unternehmen, wovon der Großteil der Kollegen in der Softwareentwicklung verteilt auf alle Standorte angesiedelt sind. Zum Gesamtpaket gehören 30 Urlaubstage, flexible Arbeitszeiten, eine top Ausstattung, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Weiterbildungen, Feiern auf der Dachterrasse etc.
              Um für diese Stelle in Frage zu kommen, sollten Sie Erfahrung mit den oben genannten Themen, sowie einen höheren Abschluss (Master, Diplom, Promotion o.ä.) mitbringen. 
    Wenn Sie sich in dieser Position sehen und sich vorstellen möchten, übersenden Sie bitte Ihren Lebenslauf an recruiting@hirebird.de  
Die Ansprechpartnerin für diese Position, Christa Neumann, wird sich daraufhin mit Ihnen in Verbindung setzen.  
Bei HireBird bringen erfahrene Personalberater durch beste Vernetzung Softwareentwickler und Unternehmen im Großraum Berlin zusammen. Mit Seriosität, Erfahrung, Diskretion und intensiver Beratung begleiten wir Sie durch die Bewerbungsphase. Unsere Prozesse sind transparent und Sie bekommen immer offenes Feedback, damit Sie wissen wo Sie stehen. Für Sie als Bewerber ist dieser Service kostenlos.  
Selbstverständlich werden all Ihre Daten streng vertraulich und diskret behandelt. Mit der Zusendung Ihrer Unterlagen stimmen Sie zu, dass diese bei uns gespeichert- und nur nach Ihrer ausdrücklichen Zustimmung an unsere Mandanten weitergegeben werden. Weitere Details hierzu können Sie in unseren  
Datenschutzbedingungen unter https://impressum.hirebird.de/#datenschutz jederzeit einsehen. Bei Fragen wenden Sie sich gern jederzeit an Ihren HireBird Personalberater oder an meinedaten@hirebird.de.

GENOPACE ist die Plattform zur Vermittlung von Baufinanzierungen der genossenschaftlichen Finanzgruppe (Volks- und Raiffeisenbanken). GENOPACE ist ein Unternehmen der Hypoport-Gruppe und deshalb sind wir alles, aber keine Bank. Hierarchien waren gestern, heute setzen wir auf Selbstverantwortung und die Motivation eines jeden einzelnen. Eine unserer Stärken ist, dass wir verschiedene neue Ansätze der Arbeitsorganisation ausprobieren.   
Wer wir sind?     
Hidden Champion:  GENOPACE ist ein Unternehmen der Hypoport-Gruppe. Wir sind seit über zehn Jahren erfolgreich und haben den Finanzierungsmarkt revolutioniert. Wir bewegen uns in einem dynamischen Umfeld und wachsen deutlich stärker als der Markt. Diese Erfolgsstory schreiben wir gerne mit dir fort.   
FinTech:    Wir sind Teil von Deutschlands größtem Finanzmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für den Verbraucher.   
B2B2C:    Wir sind B2B und denken B2C. Wir bringen Banken und Vertriebe zusammen, um für den Verbraucher den einfachsten Zugang zu den besten Finanzierungen zu schaffen. 
    
Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?     
CRM-Entwicklung:  Du entwickelst unser CRM weiter und bist dafür verantwortlich, dass alle Mitarbeiter die Informationen haben, die sie benötigen, um unsere Kunden voran zu bringen. Darüber hinaus optimierst du Prozesse und vereinfachst die Zusammenarbeit innerhalb unserer Teams.   
Berichtsentwicklung in Power BI:  Du entwickelst bestehende Berichte für unsere Kunden weiter und bist für die Neuentwicklung von Reports verantwortlich.   
Durchführung von Schulungen:  Du schulst unsere Kunden und Mitarbeiter im Umgang mit dem CRM bzw. den Berichten in Power BI und bist der primäre Ansprechpartner, wenn es um Datenbereitstellung geht.   
Erschließung   neuer Daten:  Du bindest neue Datenquellen an unsere Berichte an, damit unsere Kunden ihr Geschäft weiter optimieren können.   
Mindset  :  Du unterstützt GENOPACE auf dem Weg zu einer data-driven Organisation. 
    
Was erwarten wir von dir?     
IT- und Programmierkenntnisse:  Du beherrschst mindestens eine Programmiersprache (idealerweise Python) und kennst dich mit SQL-Datenbanken und API-Abfragen aus.   
CRM  -  Erfahrun  g  :  Du kennst dich in CRM-Systemen aus und hast auch schon Anpassungen an einem CRM-System vorgenommen. Idealerweise kennst du dich mit Microsoft Dynamics und der Integration in die Office 365 Welt aus.   
Analytisches Denken:    Du hast Spaß an Zahlen und großen Datenbanken. Dir fällt es leicht, Zusammenhänge zu erkennen und zu interpretieren, um daraus Lösungsmöglichkeiten abzuleiten. Außerdem hast du ein gutes Prozessverständnis und es macht dir Freude diese zu optimieren.   
Kommunikationsstärke:    Du hast Freude daran, mit anderen Menschen Lösungen zu finden. Hierbei formulierst du klar, verständlich und offen. Kundenwünsche prüfst du und entdeckst die Motivation dahinter.   
Innovationsfreude:  Du hast kreative Ideen, probierst gerne Neues aus und gehst auch mal einen unüblichen Weg. 
    
Was dich bei uns erwartet?     
Freiraum:  Du bekommst Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken. Auch zeitlich sind wir flexibel, ob du in Vollzeit oder in Teilzeit arbeiten möchtest.   
Selbstorganisation:    Bei uns gibt es kein Micro-Management und keine klassischen Hierarchien.   
Teamplay:  Echtes Miteinander im Team mit freundlichen Kollegen.   
Respekt:  Gegenseitiger Respekt & Wertschätzung und ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz.   
Familienfreundlichkeit:  Ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home-Office gerne auch unser Kids-Office nutzen.   
Karriere:  Bei uns wird dir nicht langweilig. Wir bieten dir echte Möglichkeiten dich weiterzuentwickeln. 
    
Und jetzt?   
Auf unserem PnO Blog erfährst du noch mehr über uns. Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung. Bitte mit Gehaltsvorstellung und möglichem Starttermin.
