We are looking for a (Senior) Data Engineer to join Takeaway.com’s Product Intelligence (PI) Team. As a Data Engineer you will play a key role in designing, developing and scaling systems that are used for classifying Takeaway.com’s 15 million restaurant products, modeling customers’ preferences and enhancing user experience through personalisation. 
 
      How you describe your team to your friends?  
          “I work in a specialised team that owns the product intelligence domain from start to finish. I collect data and manage systems that my data scientist colleagues need in order to develop models that can explain and predict customer preferences. When they’re finished, I take care of exposing their models as services to provide users with more relevant offers on our site, apps, newsletters etc. I work at the cutting edge of applied machine learning and manage containerised microservices and distributed systems in the cloud. I am part of a tightly-knit collective of curious people with a heterogeneous set of skills and backgrounds. Our members believe that a good team is one that is inclusive, diverse and made up of open-minded, cooperative people.”  
         The position  
            Design, develop and test ETL jobs using Spark to ensure that data is always available for exploratory data analysis, model training and model serving in the relevant storage systems - e.g. DWH, data lake, NoSQL.    
Develop, test and deploy APIs that serve data scientists’ machine learning models as scalable services in the cloud.    
Help maintain and improve our team’s Spark infrastructure (we currently use AWS EMR) to ensure that it can serve all use cases that we use Spark for (model training, ETL, real-time predictions) at a uniformly high quality.    
Orchestrate model (re)training jobs and ETL pipelines using Airflow.    
Manage and administer resources on the cloud    
         Your profile  
            You have 6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer    
Extensive knowledge across database systems (MySQL ,NoSQL)    
Strong expertise on building and deploying containerized applications (Docker, Kubernetes...)    
Proficiency in working with Python, Scala, Java, Bash    
You have a Dev-Ops mindset when solving problems (CD/CI are part of you’re developer effort)    
Strong knowledge on cloud infrastructure (AWS is a plus)    
You have first-hand experience in building RESTful services for production.    
You have extensive experience in developing, deploying and tuning Spark applications.    
You have experience with Spark cluster management and a willingness to optimise performance, automate provisioning, scaling and alerting.    
You have an analytical mind and are a keen problem solver.    
         Our Offer  
            As you’ll be joining a young team, you will be constantly presented with novel puzzles You’ll become part of a team that prides itself in owning its stack and you’ll have the opportunity to make your voice heard during technical and design discussions - your opinion will count.      
Company contribution toward your pension saving    
Awesome (global) team events like the summer party, skiing trip and more!    
Table football, billiards and Xbox in the kitchen    
Contribution to your travel cost with the amount of the BVG monthly abonnement    
An attractive location with roof terrace close to Potsdamer Platz    
Workshops, conferences and training seminars to support our growing team    
Inhouse German language courses

Unternehmensbeschreibung  
  Du möchtest das digitale Wachstum eines der größten deutschen Medienhäuser vorantreiben? Dich faszinieren Echtzeit-Auktionen, Automatisierung und Innovationen?  Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

Wir ermöglichen wir den  vollautomatisierten Verkauf von Werbeanzeigen  auf unseren Webseiten  in Echtzeit-Auktionen.  Durch den  Einsatz neuster Technologien,   datengetriebener Pricing-Strategien  sowie das  Hochrechnen und Segmentieren von Nutzerdaten  maximieren wir den Umsatz für unsere Websites und finanzieren digitalen Journalismus.  Ausgeprägtes technisches Verständnis, solide Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. SQL, Python, JavaScript) und Umgang mit Couldplattformen (z. B. AWS) 
 Passion für Analytics, Statistik und digitale Geschäftsmodelle 
 Fähigkeit pragmatisch und strukturiert Fragestellungen zu bearbeiten und zu kommunizieren 
 Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in der Erstellung von Dashboards mit Tableau, Power BI 
 Idealerweise Berufserfahrung im Bereich Programmatic, AdTech oder in einem digitalen Marktumfeld 
 Veränderungen und neuen Fragestellungen neugierig und aufgeschlossen begegnen

 Unser Angebot

Since our founding in 2015, we follow our Vision to create a world where people love insurance by using the Clark insurance Manager App. This is not only recognized by 150.000 customer; Bloomberg named us as one of the 50 most promising startups in the world 2017 as well.  you want to share your knowledge and to inspire? Be a Speaker and create your own Brownbag speech to inspire your colleagues. 
 and last but not least: Sure, we know how to celebrate success! We offer you quarterly company events, monthly team lunch & breakfast as well as our weekly Friday get together.

NewStore operates a platform for retailers to run their stores on iPhone. It provides Omnichannel-as-a-Service with the only integrated cloud OMS and mobile POS. Intuitive store associate apps allow retailers to offer seamless shopping experiences through endless aisle, mobile checkout, store fulfillment, real-time inventory and clienteling. With an API-first architecture and an expansive ecosystem of partners, retailers can deploy fast and flexible omnichannel with ease. Brands that run on the NewStore platform include Decathlon, Outdoor Voices, UNTUCKit and more. NewStore was founded by Stephan Schambach, who pioneered ecommerce at Demandware (now Salesforce Commerce Cloud). The company has offices in Berlin, Boston and New York. Learn more at www.newstore.com.
  
About the Job
  
As Data Engineer, you develop fast, accurate, robust and scalable data-processing pipelines in an agile environment. You are also responsible for the deployment, monitoring and operation of our Kafka based streaming platform. Collaborating closely with other teams to improve and enhance the data model and quality will be part of your daily work.
  
 Responsibilities:  
 
 Design and develop a real-time events pipeline and work with backend engineers and product managers to find new ways to leverage this data 
 Design data models and intelligent data structures to support stream processing and application integration 
 Contribute to the evolution of our stream processing services and infrastructure 
 Evaluate and introduce state-of-the-art technologies and best practices to continually improve our data processing approach 
 Coach our engineering teams on data modelling 
 
 Your skills:  
 
 Strong skills with data engineering / streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, Flink 
 Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server) and NoSQL data stores (Elasticsearch, DynamoDB) 
 Experience with building data pipelines 
 Excellent communication and problem solving skills and willingness to discuss data models with business stakeholders 
 Ability to quickly understand business requirements and transform them into data models 
 Strong English communication skills 
 
 Other skills and experience we value:  
 
 Programming skills with Scala / Java 
 Experience in working with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) is a plus 
 Experience in data science is a plus 
 Familiarity with AWS cloud technologies 
 Willingness to work in an agile environment

emetriq ist ein Anbieter für datengetriebene Online-Advertising-Lösungen und Teil der Deutschen Telekom AG. Wir bieten unseren Kunden innovative Lösungen auf Basis von komplett inhouse entwickelter, geballter Daten- und Technologiekompetenz. Kurz gesagt: Wir sorgen dafür, dass Online-Werbung relevanter und präziser wird.   
  
     emetriq ist vor allem ein Team von motivierten und cleveren Leuten, die sich nicht weniger vorgenommen haben, als den deutschen Online-Werbemarkt nachhaltig zu verändern, kollaborativer und fairer zu machen. Unser Kundenportfolio reicht von den Top10 AGOF-Vermarktern bis zu Online Big Playern. In unserem Hamburger Büro direkt am Hafen erwartet Dich neben einem spannenden Aufgabengebiet mit viel Eigenverantwortung und Raum für eigene Ideen, ein familiäres und dynamisches Team von ca. 90 Kolleginnen und Kollegen mit ausgeprägtem Teamgeist, flachen Hierarchien und jeder Menge Spaß. Klingt perfekt? Wir sind nicht perfekt. Wir machen Fehler und lernen dazu. Wir arbeiten mit Energie und Leidenschaft und entwickeln uns Schritt für Schritt weiter. Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir  ab sofort  einen  Data Engineer (m/w/d)  zur Festanstellung. 
     Wie du uns helfen kannst:  
  Du hilfst uns, bei der Neugestaltung und Weiterentwicklung unserer ML-Pipelines nicht nur up-to-date zu sein, sondern auch vorauszudenken und verwendest dafür Technologien wie Apache Spark. 
 Du machst unsere Plattform leistungsfähiger und skalierbarer: Du kennst dich mit Cloud-Diensten (z.B. AWS) aus und wendest deine Erfahrungen auf unsere Plattform an. 
 Du unterstützt uns dabei, unsere Produkte ausfallsicher, zuverlässig und performant zu halten, indem du test-driven programmierst und die Qualität unserer Software (Java, Scala, Python) durch Pairing, Code Reviews, Dokumentation und Clean Code hochhältst. 
 Du arbeitest gerne mit Machine Learning, Data Mining oder Natural Language Processing und unterstützt uns dabei, entsprechende Algorithmen zu verbessern und produktiv einzusetzen. 
 Du kannst dich tief in ein komplexes Problem eingraben und teilst deine Erkenntnisse gern mit dem Rest des Teams und trägst so aktiv zum Wissensaustausch im Team bei. 
 Du willst in einem crossfunktionalen Team arbeiten und trägst mit deinem offenen Auftreten zur guten Stimmung und angenehmen Atmosphäre bei. 
 Du beteiligst dich aktiv am unternehmerischen Leben und hilfst uns dabei, die agilen Prozesse weiterzuentwickeln und zu verbessern. 
     Was du mitbringst:  
  Wir wollen dir nicht vorgeben, ob oder was du studiert haben solltest oder wo du deine Berufserfahrung gesammelt hast. Wenn dir das beschriebene Aufgabenfeld und unser Umfeld zusagt und du denkst, dass du uns gut unterstützen kannst, dann melde dich bei uns. 
 Und übrigens: Wir glauben an den Leitsatz „Hire for Attitude, Train for Skills“ – somit sind für uns Team-Fit und die richtige Einstellung wichtiger als so manch erlernbare Fertigkeit. 
     Was wir bieten.  
   Wir glauben an die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben – auch im dynamischen Online-Umfeld. Deshalb sind flexible Arbeitszeiten für uns selbstverständlich. Unser motiviertes Team arbeitet direkt an der Elbe, am Hamburger Hafen in einer tollen Atmosphäre. Dazu zählen Jobs, die Spaß machen, herausfordernde Tätigkeiten und ein hohes Maß an Teamwork. Zahlreiche gemeinsame Aktivitäten und tolles Equipment (wie z.B. Teamevents, Restaurant-Gutscheine, ein leistungsfähiger Mac, Kopfhörer, Kickertisch und Playstation) machen das Arbeiten noch attraktiver. Bei uns sind die Lernkurven steil und werden von passgenauen Entwicklungsmaßnahmen begleitet. Werde ein Teil von emetriq und gestalte die Erfolgsgeschichte unseres wachsenden Unternehmens aktiv mit. 
   Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?  
Uns reicht dein Xing-Profil – kontaktiere Lucille Bumann direkt bei XING oder schick uns deinen Link per Mail an: jobs@emetriq.com.
 
Alternativ kannst du auch deine Bewerbungsunterlagen über unsere Jobbörse senden.
 
Bei Fragen steht dir Lucille zur Seite. 
 
 
Datenschutz wird bei uns großgeschrieben. Unsere Datenschutzhinweise findest du hier .  
      Ansprechpartner  
    Lucille Bumann
  +49 40/80813-7048 
 jobs@emetriq.com

medpex is one of the largest German mail-order pharmacies and thus an important player in two of the most exciting growth markets: e-commerce and healthcare. In well-known tests, the mail-order pharmacy received top marks for reliable service, good advice and fast delivery.
 Based in the Rhine-Neckar region, we ship around 400,000 packages per month – to more than five million customers throughout Germany.
 We are a young and innovative company with a strong corporate culture, a good dose of start-up, and steady growth. Currently we employ more than 400 people.
  To grow further we need more of our biggest success factor:  talented, qualified and motivated employees. That is why we are looking for an Data Engineer (m/f/d) for our offices in Mannheim.
  
Your tasks will be
  
 
 Set-up, conception, implementation and continuous development of our business intelligence infrastructure 
 Connection of different data sources (MSSQL, Google Analytics etc.) to BigQuery 
 Independent preparation and transformation of data in Google BigQuery 
 Preparation of deviation, trend, ad-hoc analyses and forecasting using QlikView 
 Support and coaching of the departments in the preparation of QlikView reports 
 Continuous quality assurance of reports through code reviews 
 
What we expect from you
  
 
 Degree, preferably in business computer science, computer science, mathematics or comparable qualification 
 First professional experience as a data scientist 
 Knowledge of database and big data technologies (MSSQL, MySQL, BigQuery) as well as with visualization tools like QlikView or Tableau 
 Knowledge of the programming languages Java or Python 
 Knowledge of BI tools (Apache Airflow, Apache Kafka) is an advantage 
 Structured and analytical approach 
 Excellent knowledge of German and good knowledge of English 
 
What you can expect
  
 
 Current technology. We love tech. 
 Start-up flair with regular collective events (like bubble football, laser tag or canoeing) 
 Flexible working hours with one day of home office per week 
 Bright offices with a football table, Nintendo Switch, relax lounge and the choice between an open-plan or 4-person office 
 Modern tech equipment 
 Dell XPS Notebook with Windows 10 (Company Standard) or MacBook Pro (OS X) 
 Company mobile phone (iPhone or Android) 
 Free choice of IDE and work equipment (mouse, keyboard, etc.) 
 Height-adjustable desks 
 Flat hierarchies, communication as equals, first name basis and no dress code. 
 Air-conditioned offices, located near the city center and the main train station, but also near green areas 
 Individual training and development opportunities 
 Fresh fruit, drinks and coffee flat rate to keep energy levels up 
 Exclusive employee discounts 
 
Curious? Experience more about our vision and culture on https://jobs.medpex.de/#aboutus ( https://jobs.medpex.de/#aboutus ).
 Our offices in Mannheim are conveniently located and well connected to local and long-distance public transport. Shops in the city center, restaurants and parks are located in the immediate vicinity.
  
We look forward to receiving your application and having you as part of our team. Please remember to include your last certificates along with your cover letter and CV when you apply.
  
For further questions please contact Ann-Kathrin Stritzel by phone at 0621 397316 654.

stenon is the world’s first real-time soil analysis solution for agriculture. 
 
With our IoT solution consisting of intelligent sensor fusion, artificial intelligence and data analysis, we are solving a major and global problem in agriculture and society. We provide the necessary data for cultivation optimization that is currently not economically accessible and thus create extreme value for farmers. 
  
You will:  
 
  Play a crucial role in the development of our data models 
 
  Design and setup the complete data processing infrastructure 
 
  Improve data processing to ensure we can process millions of datasets in shortest time frames 
 
  Constantly track, monitor and re-evaluate data models in regards to real-time user data 
 
  Define the technical roadmap together with the CTO and the VP of Software Engineering 
 
  Be the bridge between our Data and Software team and work closely with these departments
     You are:  
 
  Customer Focused: You measure the success of your work with the actual value created for the user and the business. You don't consider your job to be done until you receive this feedback. 
 
  Up To Code: You have more than 4 years hands-on experience with writing code and (big) data processing (e.g. Python, Hadoop, Spark, SQL) that not only works but is maintainable. You always strive to pick the appropriate tools and technologies for the given problem. 
 
  End-to-end responsible: If you work on a project, you care about the whole life-cycle: Ideation, planning, coding, testing, deploying and getting called at night if things break. 
 
  A Problem Solver: The input to your work is not a highly detailed task list, but a problem. Starting from there you work closely with the team to come up with a solution, that you can iteratively validate 
 
   We offer:   
  
 
 working on a meaningful product with actual impact 
 freedom to solve real-world problems within your own area of responsibility and ownership 
 a modern and flexible tech-stack 
 choice of development hardware (MacBook or Thinkpad) 
 personal development and education (e.g. possibility to participate in meetups and conferences) 
 a diverse team of experienced and engaged developers and scientists 
 public transport ticket 
   What it's like to work at stenon?  
 
We are on a mission to make soil data accessible in real-time and thus changing the way farmers are able to cultivate their land. To achieve this we put our customers first and try to deeply understand the challenges they have. This will allow us to build the best possible products. 
 
We value transparency and honesty to become as performant as possible. With an open, yet always constructive feedback culture we learn from each other and improve constantly. 
 
 We have high standards and reward performance, but at the same time we want to work with positive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well.

----------
 HelloFresh
 ----------
  
At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe's vibrant tech hub Berlin, we've become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.
  
We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 12 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London, Amsterdam and Copenhagen and shipped out more than 250 Million meals in 2019.
  
Our more than 5,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged.
  
We want you to join us and help take HelloFresh to the next level - as a company in its growth phase this is a great time to join. Career and development opportunities are endless.
  
We will encourage you to make an immediate impact in your area of work as well as empower you to grow your career with us.
  
Our Engineering, Data, Product and Security teams are located in Berlin and New York and are critical to what we do. From procurement tools, to conversion rate optimization, live pricing tools, payment services and add-on upselling features, we work on challenging problems and have a high output of building and releasing features and engines that make our business thrive and deliver real financial impact.
  
You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our tech blog ( https://engineering.hellofresh.com/ ).
  
-------------
 About the job
 -------------
  
As a Senior Data Engineer at HelloFresh, you will be collaborating to build a robust and highly performant data platform using cutting-edge technologies. You will develop distributed services that process data in batch and real-time with a focus on scalability, data quality, and business requirements. You will have the opportunity to work on challenging data-related problems and building a self-serve data platform, like:
  
 
 Building reusable technology that enables teams to capture, process, store, and serve their data products in an easy way 
 Building and maintaining complex and scalable ETL pipelines 
 Working closely with the data infrastructure team 
 Collaborating closely with business stakeholders like Marketing, Product Analytics, etc. 
 Driving data quality and governance 
 
----------------------
 Who we are looking for
 ----------------------
  
 
 Extensive experience in Software Engineering and the ability to design, implement and deliver maintainable and high-quality code with Python 
 Previously worked on OOP and design patterns 
 Deliver scalable production-ready solutions 
 Strong problem-solving skills 
 Extensive experience with Apache Spark, Hive, and Kafka 
 Experience with AWS infrastructure (S3, EMR, Glue, Athena) 
 Experience with data modeling and data warehousing solutions 
 Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, ability to build effective communication structures in a fast-growing engineering organization 
 Exceptional technical background and a demonstrated clear impact on achieving business goals 
 Demonstrable past experience with Agile methodologies, with a strong focus on data-driven experimentation, lean thinking, and quick iterations 
 
-------------
 What we offer
 -------------
  
 
 Relocation assistance to move to Berlin and visa application support 
 Competitive compensation 
 Significant reduction in our meal kits 
 Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources 
 Sabbatical Policy 
 Work in our office located in the heart of Berlin 
 A diverse and vibrant international environment 
 A range of perks (Free in-house crash course in German, compensation for advanced German classes, in-house lecture series, and knowledge sharing program, discounts for our neighboring gym & Urban Sports Club, free weekly yoga classes, summer & winter parties, discount on our HelloFresh GO vending machines) 
 The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase 
 
---------------------------
 Are you up for a challenge?
 ---------------------------
  
Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

jobtitle: Data Engineer to an Industrial Company (near Nürnberg)
description:
Join a German dynamic global technology company near  Nürnberg  to build the Data & Analytics Cloud Platform for the whole company. Work in  Azure  cloud environment,  Docker ,  Kubernetes ,  Ansible ,  Terraform ,  Python  and  Java .   Company:    Our client is a multinational company with over 92,000 employees worldwide, that uses quality, technology, and innovation to shape the developments that will define the  mobility of tomorrow . In the last decade, they have shifted from offering basic components to complete systems solutions. They are present in internal combustion engines, the wheel of a high-speed train, or the drive of a machine tool. They are working on linking data from products and processes consistently with each other to provide the most innovative services to  increase energy efficiency . Being a multinational company, they offer unlimited development opportunities and employee training.   Project:    The team is building a Data & Analytics Cloud Platform for the whole corporation group so the data will be coming from the production lines, also from the client's lines. For the past couple of years, they have been designing the architecture and now will be implementing the design. So they are looking for people who are not afraid to make their hands dirty. The Pltaform is based in the  Azure  cloud.   Location:  Herzogenaurach (near Nürnberg), Germany.   Type of contract:   Permanent onsite position.   Recruitment process:    3 stages: First interview with Team Lead, a Technical Interview, and HR on-site interview.   International candidates are welcomed to apply. The company provides a relocation package.    As a Data Engineer you will :   Design and implement end-to-end data solutions for large-scale data architectures and applications.    Work hands-on with Big Data tools, Analytics & Semantic Frameworks in the company's Azure Cloud.    Connect data sources and ingest batch/stream data into a Data & Analytics Platform.    Implement and manage ETL processes, data transformations, data flows and service APIs according to technical guidelines, best practices, and business requirements.    Implement optimized data representations (views) and aggregations from multiple data sources.    Define and implement data ingestion, retention, lineage and access policies.    Define and implement data service API management and usage policies.   Define and use conceptual and semantic data models in data integration, transformation, and provisioning tasks, and aligning these activities with supporting Data Architects.  Requirements  Ideal Candidate:     Solid experience with one of these programming languages: Python or Java.    Experience with any Cloud services: AWS, Google Cloud or Azure (preferred).    Proficiency with SQL (e.g., MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL).    Non relational Databases (e.g., MongoDB).    Linux/Bash.    Proficient English or German.    Nice to have skills:     Working experience with Azure (Data Factory, ADLS) is highly appreciated.    Data modeling and ETL processes.    Docker, Kubernetes.    Big Data (Hadoop: Spark and Hive)    Automatization of pipelines.    ERP (SAP/ SAP-BW).    University diploma is not mandatory.   Benefits   The company welcomes candidates from all over the world    Visa sponsorship and relocation budget.    Flexible working time.    Health management plans.    Company pension.    Company sports club.   Job Types: Full-time, Permanent  Salary: 55,000.00€ to 120,000.00€ /year

Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?    
Wartung und Weiterentwicklung bestehender ETL-Strecken in der AWS-Cloud  
  technische Weiterentwicklung bestehender Architekturen mit Serverless Lambdas, AWS Batch, AWS
   Glue, AWS Athena und AWS Redshift 
  Sicherstellung der Datenqualität  Monitoring und Alerting mit CloudWatch     
Technisches Self-Service-Enablement von firmeninternen Datenproduzenten und Konsumenten  
  Hands-On-Support bei der Unterstützung von anderen Units bei der Einbindung neuer Datenquellen
   oder Analytics-Tools wie Qlik-Sense   
Support bei der robusten und nachhaltigen Produktivstellung von komplexen Machine-Learning Applikationen  
  Unterstützung unsere Machine Learning Engineers und Data Scientists bei der Erstellung robuster
   Trainings-Pipelines 
  Umsetzung von Monitoring-Metriken und Alerting  Unterstützung bei der Bereitstellung für Ressourcen für POCs von Data Science Features     
Was wir von dir erwarten    
Faulheit ;)  du willst nicht mehrmals das gleiche tun und liebst Automatisierung   
Best and Worst Practices:  du hast schon einiges erlebt und bringst deine Expertise und Erfahrung mit AWS mit ins Team   
Pragmatismus:  du strebst nach einfachen und übersichtlichen Lösungen 
  du hinterfragst, ob Dinge zielführend sind, ohne das Ziel aus den Augen zu verlieren  dabei helfen dir deine bereits gesammelten beruflichen Erfahrungen und dein Interesse an
   Automatisierung   
Kommunikationsstarker Teamplayer:  du bist mit Herz und Seele Teamplayer 
  du formulierst klar und verständlich, bist zudem offen und durchsetzungsstark     
Interesse:  dein Interesse hilft dir mit deiner schnellen Auffassungsgabe, rasch neue Themen zu adaptieren 
  du engagierst du dich, bringst dich ein und bist motiviert, uns voranzubringen     
Praxis-Erfahrung mit:  
  Python (2-Jahre+)  Java (wünschenswert)  SQL (2-Jahre+)  NoSql-Datenbanken (wünschenswert)  gängigen Entwicklungsumgebungen (wünschenswert)  Programmierstandards (Testing, Formatting, Github Workflows sind dir wichtig)     
Was dich bei uns erwartet    
Data-Community:  
  Brown Bag Lunches, Hackathons, Beer/Whisky Friday, After Work und Team Events  Journal Clubs     
Freiraum:  
  Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken, technisch, fachlich oder auch organisatorisch     
Cross-Funktionale Teamarbeit:  
  Engineers, Domain Experts und Data Scientists erarbeiten gemeinsam Lösungen     
Flexibilität und Familienfreundlichkeit:  
  Arbeitszeit, Ort und Urlaub sind im Team flexibel  
- ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home Office gerne auch unser Kids- 
 Office nutzen   
Agile:  
  wir realisieren unsere Anforderungen im Kanban-Prozess mit Stand-ups, Prio-Meetings und
   Projektboards   
Persönliches Weiterentwicklung:  
  … ist bei uns Voraussetzung die wir entsprechend unterstützen und kein Benefit     
Holakratische Selbstorganisation  
  als Unternehmen organisieren wir uns holakratisch und bringen Denken und Handeln zusammen     
Innersource-Prinzipien:  
  unseren Softwareentwicklungsprozess gestalten wir kollaborativ, offen und transparent  Fehler sind eine natürliche Eigenschaft von Entwicklungsprozessen  als wichtigstes Werkzeug nutzen wir die Features von Github (Issues, PRs, Komments, Branching,  
 Doku)   
Respekt:  
  gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung sowie ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz     
Tech-Stack:  
  wir sind flexibel in der Auswahl unserer Tools und Techniken, hier ein Auszug:   
  AWS Cloud Development Kit  GitHub  Splunk  Docker  Serverless  AWS Glue  Qlik-Sense     
Was tun wir?    
Hidden Champion:  
Die Europace AG ist ein Tochterunternehmen der Hypoport Gruppe. Wir sind seit über zehn Jahren erfolgreich und haben den Finanzierungsmarkt revolutioniert. Mit unseren Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd. Euro im Monat und einem Wachstum, das deutlich über dem Markt liegt, schreiben wir gerne mit dir unsere Erfolgsstory fort.   
FinTech:  
Wir sind Deutschlands größter Finanzmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für den Verbraucher.   
B2B2C:  
Wir sind B2B und denken B2C. Wir bringen Banken und Vertriebe zusammen, um für den Verbraucher den einfachsten Zugang zu den besten Finanzierungen zu schaffen.   
Und jetzt?   
Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung. Bitte mit Gehaltsvorstellung und möglichem Starttermin. 
 
Mehr Informationen dazu, wie wir hier arbeiten bekommst du auch auf unserem EUROPACE-Blog und Welcome @ Europace.

Über uns
    nu3 ist seit 2011 führender Anbieter für gesunde Ernährung. In unseren Online Shops in Deutschland, der Schweiz, Österreich, Italien und Frankreich finden Ernährungsbewusste alles, was zu ihrem Healthy Lifestyle passt. Zudem betreiben wir regelmäßig interaktive Pop-up Stores in Paris, die unsere Marke erlebbar machen.  
In Berlin entwickelt unser Team aus fast 60 Mitarbeitern Premium Produkte, die zu gesunder Ernährung, Fitness und Gewichtsmanagement passen. Neben unseren eigenen erfolgreichen nu3 Produkten in den Kategorien Superfoods, Fitness und Gesundheit bieten wir eine Auswahl an bekannten Marken für eine ausgewogene Ernährung. 
     Dein Aufgabenbereich
      As a Data Engineer (f/m/d) you are responsible for the conception, design and development of our business intelligence data landscape.  
You focus on data modeling and leave the implementation to our BI automation solution from WhereScape.  
You develop loading processes between Source, Persistent Staging Area, Data Vault and Data Mart with ease.  
For our departments, you are the point of contact for business issues.  
     Was du mitbringen solltest  
    Quality and performance tuning are the essence of your work.  
Your studies are almost a minor matter - much more important is your dedication to data, which you always put into a business context.  
You have gained at least 3 years of relevant experience in a BI environment.  
You're fluent in SQL and have excellent knowledge of stored procedures, indexes and constraints.  
Having implemented a reporting system and programming skills in PowerShell would be a plus.  
With your colleagues you communicate fluently in English and/or German.  
      Was wir dir bieten  
    Full time permanent contract.  
Regular feedback as a primary component in our way of talent development.  
An office in the heart of Berlin for convenient commuting.  
Free soda, juices, daily fresh fruit/ vegetables, cereals and products from our shop.  
Team-events and employee discounts.  
      Benötigte Bewerbungsunterlagen  
  CV, Cover Letter

Deine Aufgaben 
   Du entwickelst skalierbare Anwendungen zur automatisierten Konsolidierung, Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen - von Konzeption über Prototyping bis zur Produktion, Batch und Real-Time. 
   Du implementierst moderne Datenplattformen auf Basis Big Data/Hadoop, integrierst bestehende Datenbanksysteme (z.B. SQL) und bindest unterschiedlichste externe Datenquellen ein (Wetterdaten, Geodaten, etc.). 
   Du evaluierst die neuesten Tools und Technologien, nimmst direkten Einfluss auf unsere Architekturentscheidungen inkl. DevOps-Prozesse und treibst innovative Lösungen für das Daten- und Analysemanagement voran. 
   Gemeinsam mit unseren Data Scientists setzt Du spannende Anwendungsfälle mit Daten aller Art (z.B. Zeitreihen, Bilder, Dokumente) aus Research & Development, Produktion und IoT unter Nutzung modernster Analysemethoden (Statistik, Machine Learning, Deep Learning) um. 
   Du sorgst für eine fortlaufende Qualitäts- und Performanceverbesserung und betreust Anwendungen eigenverantwortlich bis zur Übergabe an den Betrieb.  
     Deine Stärken 
   Du hast Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung von großen Datenmengen mit verteilten Open-Source Systemen, on-premise und Cloud, wie z.B. Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Hbase, Oozie, Airflow, Kafka. 
   Du kennst Dich aus mit Datenbankdesign, SQL/OLAP sowie NoSQL (z.B. MongoDB, Elastic) Datenbanken, spaltenorientierten Datenbanktechnologien. 
   Du hast produktive Daten- und Analysepipelines mit Python, Scala oder Java erstellt, optimiert und in einem Enterprise-Umfeld mit typischen Sicherheitsanforderungen (z.B. Kerberos, Datenverschlüsselung) in den Betrieb überführt. 
   Du besitzt Grundkenntnisse in der Systemadministration in Linux/Unix (z.B. Cron, LDAP). 
   Du fühlst Dich in einem agilen Arbeitsumfeld wohl und nutzt Continuous Deployment Tools & Methoden (z.B. Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Jenkins), um iterativ und reproduzierbar Ergebnisse zu liefern. 
   Hohes Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Teamfähigkeit und Spaß an der Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden zeichnen Dich aus. 
   Du verfügst über fließende Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse.

Careem is the leading technology platform for the greater Middle East. A pioneer of the region’s ride-hailing economy, Careem is expanding services across its platform to include payments, delivery and mass transportation. Careem’s mission is to simplify and improve the lives of people and build a lasting institution that inspires. Established in July 2012, Careem operates in more than 120 cities across 15 countries and has created more than one million job opportunities in the region.  
  
 
As a Senior Data Engineer you will: 
 
 Build ETL pipelines and create solutions for data measurement, to enable data scientists & product teams analyze the data effectively (Spark, Hive, etc.) 
 Develop techniques to analyze and enhance both structured and unstructured data 
 Implement streaming pipelines using Spark Streaming, Kafka (Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, etc.) and AWS Products (Dynamo DB, Lambda, Kinesis, S3, etc.) 
 Make sure pipelines are production-ready, including IaaC best practices and monitoring 
 Own data products – from development to production 
 Work in an agile team with other Data Engineers as well as work with different product teams  
   
  
Requirements  
 
The ideal candidate will have a passionate commitment to improving the lives of people, an insane focus on excellence and customer service, and a strong alignment with our core values: being bold, focused, agile and collaborative.  
  
 
 In-depth experience in programming efficient, scalable, reliable data pipelines in Java or Scala 
 Solid knowledge of database systems concepts (data modeling, partitioning, indexing, joins, etc.) 
 Familiarity with theoretical distributed systems concepts and parallel data processing 
 Hands-on experience deploying and using the Apache Big Data Stack (Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.) 
 Solid Linux system and CLI skills: ssh, process monitoring, storage management, tailing logs, etc. 
 Hands-on RDBMS (e.g., Oracle or MySQL) skills  
   
 
It’s a big plus if you also bring one or more of the following: 
 
 Python scripting, especially for data processing 
 A great agile mindset and hands-on experience 
 Experience working with and maintaining clusters consisting of 10s-1000s of machines 
 Experience with AWS (EC2, S3, EMR, Kinesis, Lambda) 
 Working knowledge of containerization (Docker), and supporting technologies 
 Experience with orchestration tools like Airflow 
 Knowledge and experience with version control systems (GIT) and Java build systems (maven) 
 Experience with CI/CD tools, including Jenkins  
   
  
What do we offer you?  
 
Working in an international environment with colleagues from 70+ nationalities, ownership culture, flexible working hours, unlimited (paid!) holidays and the latest technologies.

Why are we hiring?
 ------------------
  
 
 Machine Learning is revolutionizing the way of doing business at a global scale. In consumer lending business, Kreditech takes the technological forefront by developing proprietary technology that allows to automatically take accurate decisions based in multiple data sources in a fraction of seconds. YOU will contribute to further develop the in-house data science technology by engineering and productizing novel pipelines, pipelines and models. 
 
A day in this job
 -----------------
  
 
 Work closely with data scientists to operationalize proprietary machine learning technology to different problems such as: credit risk modeling, customer acquisition and retention, debt collection optimization, product personalization and conversion maximization; 
 Design and maintain scalable ETL infrastructure usable in multiple scenarios and applications (e.g.: data science/analytics, product, risk management); 
 Run machine learning tests and experiments. 
 Design and develop health and performance monitoring tools of data pipelines and the production machine learning technologies. 
 Design and improve heterogenous, asynchronous and high-performance large-data processing pipelines. 
 Demonstrate your leadership skills and manage a data-driven project or product; 
 Operationalize innovative, data-intensive, end-to-end fully automated machine-learning(ML)-based decision engines 
 
Desired skills and experience
 -----------------------------
  
 
 Personality: motivating attitude, profound communication and strong interpersonal skills 
 Experience and Knowledge: 2+ years of in-depth knowledge and professional working experience with software engineering, ETL pipelines and setting up machine learning workflows from preprocessing up to the final model, proficiency in Python and/or R, Experience in implementing and deploying REST microservices, Basic understanding of data science principles 
 Languages: fluent in English 
 Commitment to excellence and high professional and ethical standards; 
 We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible! 
 
What is in it for you?
 ----------------------
  
 
 You will be joining a dynamic and diverse, multifunctional and multidisciplinary team of 10 data scientists plus one research oriented PhD student that collaborate to change the future of lending. We are passionate about designing, implementing, executing and monitoring our solutions in real world; 
 You will learn how to build, maintain and update production-ready data science artefacts at scale while leveraging in proprietary machine learning technology - which you can even create yourself. 
 You will feel the excitement of extracting value from data and impacting the performance of an entire organization. Kreditech is a 100% data science centered organization. The solutions productized by our team already personalized credit offers to more than 4 million individuals worldwide in the last 5 years. Out of those, our technology autonomously decided to lend more than 500 million euros. All of this happened with a 100% human free lead cycle; 
 You will join one of the fastest growing Fintech organizations; 
 You will work in an awesome office in the heart of Hamburg with the best views from the city and plenty of things to do nearby. 
 
At Kreditech, we like to constantly challenge the status quo and improve our ways of working. We are a data driven company and believers of agile methods. Diversity is in our DNA and we strongly believe that having different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds will lead to the best environment for our employees and better products to our customers.
  
If this sounds like the kind of company you'd like to work with, please complete our online application.
  
How to apply?
 -------------
  
 
 We accept applications exclusively through the application form below.

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich für DB Cargo AG am Standort Mainz:
 
 Deine Aufgaben:  
 
  Als Data Engineer arbeitest Du mit beim Ausbau und Betrieb des DB Cargo Data Lakes.
  Du begleitest die Initiativen des Unternehmens zur Vernetzung bislang isolierter Datenbereiche, um hierdurch neue Analysemöglichkeiten und die Grundlagen für neue Geschäftsideen zu schaffen.
  Weiterhin bist Du verantwortlich für die Anbindung von neuen Datenquellen und Schnittstellen mit modernen ETL-Werkzeugen und stimmst Dich dazu mit den Schnittstellenpartnern ab.
  Darüber hinaus sorgst Du gemeinsam im Team für einen offenen, verantwortungsvollen und nachhaltigen Umgang mit Daten bei DB Cargo, u.a. durch die Unterstützung beim Aufbau eines konzernweiten Datenkatalogs, durch die Gestaltung und Sicherstellung von zukunftssicheren Data Governance Standards und Etablierung eines übergreifenden Stammdaten- und Datenqualitätsmanagements.
  Zu Deinen Aufgaben gehören zudem die Koordinierung der Anforderungen aus den Fachbereichen, das Vernetzen innerhalb des gesamten DB Konzerns und die Rolle des Übersetzers und Multiplikators für das Thema Data Intelligence innerhalb einer Community mit internen und externen Partnern.   
 
Dein Profil :
 
  Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes (Fach-)Hochschulstudium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
  Du bringst mehrjährige operative Berufserfahrung und belastbare Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Data Engineering und/oder Data Science mit.
  Erfahrungen in relationalen Datenbanken, in MSSQL, MySQL, SSIS, Python, Linux, Oracle und im Netzwerkumfeld (TCP/IP) setzen wir voraus.
  Idealerweise bringst Du Kenntnisse in Java, Hadoop, Athena, Apache Nifi und Airflow und Cloud Computing (Amazon Webservices) mit.
  Du verfügst über ein sehr gutes analytisches Verständnis, eine ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung und Servicementalität.
  Du dokumentierst Deine fachlichen Erkenntnisse und begeisterst Deine Teamkollegen mit Deinen Ideen.
  Du kannst ansprechende Präsentationen erstellen und trägst sie gern einem anspruchsvollen Publikum vor.

Onlineshopping ohne Logistik? Kann nicht funktionieren. Genau deshalb stellt Hermes Germany als zweitgrößter deutscher Paketdienst bis zu 2,2 Millionen Pakete pro Tag zu.      Über uns  
 envelio bietet Netzbetreibern die Software as a Service-Lösung Intelligent Grid Platform (IGP), um die Energiewende schneller und kosteneffizienter voranzutreiben. 
 
Dabei werden Algorithmen auf Basis von maschinellem Lernen und mathematischer Optimierung genutzt, um Planungs- und Betriebsprozesse in Energieverteilnetzen für die Integration von Millionen von erneuerbaren Energien und Smart Meter Daten anzupassen. 
 
Wir sind ein schnellwachsendes Spin-Off der RWTH Aachen University und unsere Intelligent Grid Platform verknüpft die Ergebnisse von fünf Dissertationen aus dem Gründerteam. 
 
Seit unserer Gründung im April 2017 haben wir unsere Lösung bereits bei einer Reihe von großen Netzbetreibern in Deutschland und Europa integriert. Wir bilden heute bereits mehr als 15% des deutschen Stromverteilnetzes in unserer skalierbaren Plattform ab.

momox ist der sechstgrößte Arbeitgeber der deutschen Digitalwirtschaft (Drittgrößter in Berlin). Mit über 200 Mio. € Umsatz und mehr als 1.600 Mitarbeiterinnen sowie Mitarbeitern wachsen wir stetig weiter. Wir sind der führende Online-Ankaufservice für Bücher, CDs, Filme, Games und Fashion. Über momox.de kaufen wir Artikel an, der Verkauf erfolgt über Online-Marktplätze sowie in den eigenen Shops medimops.de und ubup.com. Wir sind ständig auf der Suche nach begeisterungsfähigen Menschen, die Spaß daran haben, bei der momox Erfolgsstory mitzuwirken. 
 Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt für unseren Standort in Berlin eine kompetente und tatkräftige Persönlichkeit in der Funktion als Business Intelligence Developer (m/w/d).  
    DEINE MISSION   
Du verantwortest die Konzeption und Umsetzung von BI-Lösungen (DWH, ETL, Monitoring etc.)  
Dir obliegt die eigenverantwortliche Umsetzung von Arbeitspaketen im Rahmen von Projekten  
Du kümmerst Dich um die Sicherstellung des Betriebs der BI-Anwendung und um deren kontinuierliche Verbesserung (Monitoring, Alerting)  
Du optimierst unsere Durchführung von technischen und inhaltlichen Tests, zudem erstellst Du Use Cases in Zusammenarbeit mit den BI-Analysten  
Du bist zuständig für die Bearbeitung von Ad-Hoc Anfragen bei Daten, Reporting`s oder Analyse Fragestellungen  
Du erstellst Reports, Dashboards und KPI   
WARUM MOMOX?   
Wir lieben es pragmatisch. Du arbeitest in einem agilen Umfeld mit Allem was dazu gehört, aber ohne die endlosen Planungsmeetings  
Wir sind offen für neue Technologien und nutzen sie, wenn es Sinn macht  
Wir haben keine Angst vor großen architektonischen Herausforderungen  
Wir geben Dir die Möglichkeit, Dich durch die Teilnahme an Fachveranstaltungen und Konferenzen sowohl fachlich als auch persönlich weiterzuentwickeln  
Wir leben agile Entwicklung, in unseren Teams arbeiten alle Fachbereiche zusammen, die Wege sind kurz   
    DAS SOLLTEST DU MITBRINGEN   
Du verfügst über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre mit Schwerpunkt (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung  
Du verfügst über mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit Python oder einer ähnlich analytisch orientierten Programmiersprache (z.B. R, Java)  
Du hast Know-how in der Benutzung von Cloud Storage Lösungen (BigQuery, S3, Redshift), sowie von relationalen Datenbanken (MySQL, MSSQL, PostgreSQL)  
Du bringst bestenfalls bereits erste Erfahrungen mit nicht-relationalen Datenbanken (MongoDB, Hadoop, MapReduce) mit  
Du konntest tiefgehende Erfahrung bei ETL-Prozessen, der API Integration und automatisierten Verarbeitung von strukturierten sowie unstrukturierten Daten sammeln  
Die Anbindung und Datenmodellierung in SQL, inkl. der damit verbundenen Frontend Tools (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview), stellen für Dich kein Problem dar  
Du überzeugst durch Deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und Dein Verständnis von Geschäftsprozessen   
DAS MACHT MOMOX ATTRAKTIV

We're looking for a highly skilled engineer, who is passionate about building and scaling a data platform for analytical and product uses cases. We want you to drive the architecture and lead the implementation of this major data initiative. 
   
Your Responsibilities:    
Design, build and iterate on a sustainable and scalable architecture to ingest and combine data from a large number of different sources (both batch and real-time) that are spread across the organization. Successfully partner with our data teams to build the data layer to empower scalable data products for our high-traffic web platform as well as analysts to leverage data insights and provide dashboards  
Guide and advise the team as a technical lead. Infer best practices and share knowledge among other engineers in our Product and Tech unit  
Successfully partner with our system operators to design data generation and provisioning architectures  
Partner with Business, Product and Strategy to drive the data topic holistically 
    
Your Profile:    
Track record of building a scalable high-volume data infrastructure / data lake  
Good experience with Big Data related architecture and technologies (e.g. Kafka, Spark, Hadoop), with NoSQL databases (e.g. Mongo, Cassandra) and SQL databases  
Experience with building micro-services and/or distributed systems and an understanding of web tech  
Experience with different tracking infrastructures (frontend, backend) and how to combine different data sources  
Strong experience as a Java developer with a deep understanding of the surrounding technology ecosystem; Experience in Scala is a plus  
Basic understanding of Python  
Basic understanding of Data Science & Analytics  
Strong analytical skills and ability to write clean, well-maintainable code  
Desire to quickly learn new technologies and be pragmatic about the choice of tools that fits the situation  
Able to work self-driven, but also operate as part of a strong, cohesive team  
Strong communication skills and fluency in English. German would be a plus 
    
What we offer:    
Having an impact on our platform and mobile.de as a whole  
Competitive salary  
A dynamic team with interesting and driven people, and a great team spirit. We are passionate about building great data products for our users – but we also have a good sense of humor and enjoy working together.  
Room for growth: Our team is growing, and so are our responsibilities. You can take over a comprehensive field of responsibility and really make a difference  
Excellent working environment with a high level of professionalism and lots of flexibility  
International career opportunities throughout eBay Inc.  
A great campus with an extended data community at eBay Kleinanzeigen and eBay Germany  
Many on-site perks such as a fitness center, yoga and pilates classes, bike rental, coffee-bar, excellent canteen and shuttle-service. We even offer a dry-cleaning service!

The opportunity
  
Founded in 2013 in Cologne, Fitogram provides software solution for thousands of fitness professionals across Europe. Our software helps manage services such as online booking, customer management, payments and accounting. We take pride in building software enjoyable to use.
  
Our latest product FitogramPro, links the marketplace with a SaaS solution for customer, course and appointment management and thus offers an all-in-one solution. For the first time ever, fitness providers have the opportunity to manage and win customers within one single platform.
  
Our international, enthusiastic and lively team awaits you in the heart of Cologne. Let's revolutionize the sports market together!
  
We are looking for our first Data Engineer who will be an essential part of our international team and will have the possibility to learn in a fast-growing start-up environment in the heart of Cologne. As the first role of its kind at Fitogram, you will have the opportunity to steer the data usage of Fitogram and play a key role in designing and implementing solutions used within the team. To do so, you will need to employ a variety of languages and tools to marry systems together or try to hunt down opportunities to acquire new data from other systems so that the system-specific codes, for example, can become information in further processing by data scientists.
  
What you'll do
  
 
 Design, implement and optimize data pipelines to produce clean and unified data from multiple data sources 
 Optimize queries executed in distributed systems by improving query plans and carefully thinking about data partitioning and compression 
 Maintain and optimize existing data transformation processes 
 Research technologies and build software to support the work of Data Scientists and other team members in their daily work 
 Work together with the Business Intelligence team to find the best solutions to handle data pipelines and data processing 
 Manage the daily data warehouse operations 
 
What you need to succeed
  
 
 Several years of professional experience working with SQL, Python, and Airflow 
 Experience with at least one other programming language in a data-related context is a plus 
 Deep familiarity with setting up ETL processes 
 You have a strong desire to experiment with new technologies and acquire new skills to find clever solutions to the unique challenges we will encounter along the way 
 You will need to recommend and sometimes implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality 
 You are currently located within the EU (Need to relocate to Cologne? We will help you!) 
 
Our offer to you
  
 
 The opportunity to steer the data usage of Fitogram 
 Working with a highly motivated and international data team with the standard open source stack (SQL, Python, Docker, Airflow, Metabase) in an agile environment 
 The chance to conduct advanced analyses to drive business. 
 Knowledge sharing and learning opportunities in an open data culture 
 A flat hierarchy that offers a lot of self-responsibility, as well as opportunities for you to evolve and shape the company 
 An Urban Sports Club L-Membership for you and your +1 
 Up to 30 days vacation per year (26 in your first year plus one additional day for every year worked) 
 
Fitogram is committed to providing a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of their sports preferences, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).
  
------

Data Engineer – DACH Region   
We know that there are all kinds of data engineers, with varying levels of knowledge about different platforms and data sources. At InterWorks, we're more interested in candidates who are hard-working, smart and love what they do. We care more about overall database and analytical skills rather than experience with a certain database platform. Whether you have worked primarily in SQL Server, Oracle, or something else, we only ask that you have a strong understanding of SQL as a whole and can apply your skills within our fast paced and agile approach.  
While some companies may hide their data engineers away in some dungeon, data engineers at InterWorks are social, friendly creatures. That is why being able to communicate with clients day in and day out is especially valuable. Our data consultants must be able to work closely with users in order to understand their needs and help them best as possible.  
You might find it difficult to do the same thing each day. At InterWorks, Data Engineers can expect to work on diverse projects ranging from a few days to several months. Many of these projects include solving business problems using data from some of the largest organizations in the world. Projects also include working with disparate data sources (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, DB2, Excel, Hadoop, Text files, etc.) to unify client data, creating ETL processes based on client needs and managing client expectations.  
InterWorks prides itself on having an exciting work environment, with a unique (and downright nerdy) company culture. InterWorks employees are some of the most intelligent and friendly people you will ever meet – they are the primary reason for the success of InterWorks. To keep this ball rolling, we have built a knowledge sharing culture around here where everybody gets involved. Tech talks and blogs, unlimited access to online courses and opportunities to top notch tech conferences constantly refine our skillsets. Joining the InterWorks team as a Data Engineer means joining a family and our family is growing faster than ever.  
Skills and Requirements   
Here are some basic requirements that we look for in our Data engineers:   
Required:   
Excellent SQL skills  
Strong ETL skills, experience with SSIS, Alteryx, Pentaho, Informatica, or similar toolsets  
Experience in designing data warehouse  
Coding skills (PHP, Java, C#, or others)  
Excellent verbal and written communication skills  
Business acumen  
Easily adaptable and flexible to changing situations  
Passion for delivering compelling solutions that exceed client expectations  
Fluent German and English  
Hunger for variety accompanied by willingness to travel     
  
Highly Desired:    
Background in Software Engineering  
Having built data pipelines yourself Experience with Visual Analytics tools (Tableau, QlikView, Cognos, or similar)  
Experience with Web technologies (HTML, CSS, JS)    
About InterWorks   
Founded on twenty years of business consulting experience and a culture of complete client satisfaction, InterWorks delivers the absolute best in full-spectrum IT and data solutions. From servers and storage to development and visualization, our talented team leverages industry-leading technology to help organizations across the globe build a foundation for sustained success.   
About the Business Intelligence Team   
At InterWorks, we're obsessed with data at every level. This obsession has led us to assemble the most talented team of data superheroes the world has ever seen. Wielding tools like Tableau Software and Alteryx, our Business Intelligence Team has helped Fortune 500 companies, government organizations and respected universities alike get further, faster and smarter with their data strategy.

jobtitle: IT Data Engineer EMEA (all genders welcome)
description:
Goodyear. More Driven.     
 
Innovation. Trendsetting technologies. The highest quality. Goodyear Dunlop stands for the best possible connection between cars and roads. What drives us? A passion for tires! This passion is what allows our employees to set standards that are shaping an entire industry each and every day. All our employees benefit from the opportunity to distinguish themselves through multidisciplinary, international experiences. Get started right away – join the team at our site in  Hanau or Fulda  as    
  
IT Data Engineer EMEA (all genders welcome)     
  
About the position :    
 
This is an exciting opportunity to join our EMEA IT Digital and Analytics team as a Data Engineer, working within the Advanced Analytics Domain.    
 
You will be joining the team in charge of designing, developing and supervising the data pipeline for internal and external data sources. The team is constantly confronted with business challenges and you will contribute to the understanding of high level, loosely specified requirements and transform Data into Value for our business through integration, consolidation and presentation of the information in the most relevant possible way.    
 
As a main focus for the function, you will contribute to create and maintain application in the traditional and modern Data Warehouse, including modern data lake, securing cyber security, compliance and GDPR aspects are fully covered.    
  
Your tasks & responsibilities :    
  
Actively support the Digital and Analytics team in delivering state of the art solutions.  
Develop end to end, fully automated, data pipeline using different technology and tool sets.  
Work together with business partners to anticipate and help formulate analytics driven requirements.  
Establish with the team realistic project plans and facilitate the application of proper Project Management principles.  
Facilitate, and when needed, manage the technical relationship with external development partner(s).  
Mentor and train the team on new technology and trends.  
Troubleshoot customer's and technical issues during operations.  
Be an advocate for modern high-quality software engineering best practice introduction, including test driven development.  
Fusion collaboration with data science, innovation and global teams.  
Secure cyber security and data protection requirements are always completely fulfilled.     
  
Your profile:     
  
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as a working familiarity with a variety of databases.  
Practical experience in development of data pipeline in traditional and modern analytics (Data Warehouse and Data Lake). Teradata, Cognos, AWS and/or Azure (EMR, HDIinsight) practical experience is considered a plus.  
Practical experience in Scala (or Advanced Java), Python or equivalent OO development language required. Interest in learning cloud native programming languages (GO, Rust).  
Practical experience in DevOps practice and automation toolsets (CI/CD).  
A track record of project / pipeline delivery and positive collaboration with business partners and external providers. Proven understanding of infrastructure as a code, scripting, virtualization and orchestration concepts. Kubernetes and Hashicorp solutions expertise is considered a plus. Strong project management, organizational skills and analytical mindset.  
Bachelor's in Computer Science or similar technical field. Master’s degree preferred.  
3+ years of experience in a technical role preferably supporting big data infrastructure or platform development.  
Strong understanding of security, Data Protection and Privacy concepts especially related to Cloud.  
Demonstrated knowledge of Cloud platform technologies both on the infrastructure and the development side preferred.  
Strong communication skills: capable of conveying information concisely to diverse audiences; experience with communicating dynamics of complex systems in a concise and clear manner.  
Proficiency in the English language is essential, and knowledge of other languages is a plus.  
Self-motivated, accepts difficult challenges and thinks out of the box.  
Enthusiastic team player, self-learning with an interest in the automotive world.     
 
Apply now with your salary expectations and earliest possible start date.    
 
Goodyear is one of the world’s largest tire companies. It employs about 65,000 people and manufactures its products in 48 facilities in 22 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate.  
Goodyear is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

 You actively develop the platform with cutting edge technologies to streamline and analyze data flows from our existing backend infrastructure or external sources 
 You are focussed on innovative, cloud-based services and automation concepts

 vor 30+ Tagen

----------
 About Spin
 ----------
  
Spin operates electric scooters in cities and campuses nationwide, bringing sustainable last-mile mobility solutions to diverse communities. Recognized for its consistent cooperation and collaboration with cities, Spin partners closely with transportation planners, elected officials, community groups, and university administrators to bring stationless mobility options to streets in a responsible and carefully orchestrated manner.
  
Based in San Francisco, Spin is a diverse team of engineers, designers, urban planners, policymakers, lawyers and operators with experience from Y Combinator, Lyft, Uber, local and federal government, and the transportation advocacy world. Spin was known for launching the first stationless mobility program in Seattle, and has since expanded to become the exclusive electric scooter partner in mid-sized cities like Coral Gables, Florida and Lexington, Kentucky, and one of a few permitted scooter operators in large cities like Denver, Detroit, and Washington, D.C. The team embeds in cities and neighborhoods to understand their specific transportation needs, and hires locally from the community.
  
Spin is expanding quickly and looking for top-tier talent to help us bring affordable and accessible transportation options to cities and define what future safe streets will look like.
  
About the Role
  
Being a data informed company, data helps us create exceptional experience for our customers and provide insights into the effectiveness of our product.
  
We are looking for Data Engineers that will build and maintain our data warehouse and data pipelines, collect data from multiple sources, and expose services that make data a first class citizen at Spin. You will be building, architecting and launching highly reliable and scalable data pipelines to support data processing and analytics needs. Your efforts will allow access to business and user behavior insights.
  
The Team
  
Our engineering team consists engineers that are passionate about creating finely polished and intuitive experiences and, at the same time, obsess over performance and reliability of what we build. We challenge the status quo and strive towards finding the best way to solve problems.
  
We promote being a more well rounded engineer by working on different parts of the engineering stack. We also work in very small groups to keep processes and overhead low, so we have a lot of trust and accountability to perform the work required to build the best product.
  
----------------
 Responsibilities
 ----------------
  
 
 Build and maintain our data warehouse and data pipelines 
 Scaling up our data infrastructure to meet business needs 
 Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods 
 Work cross-functionally with our product, business, finance and engineering teams 
 
--------------
 Qualifications
 --------------
  
 
 Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in building and architecting data solutions 
 Deep understanding of distributed systems 
 Expert in SQL and high-level languages such as Python, Java, or Scala 
 Built and maintained data warehouses and ETL pipelines 
 Experience with Data modeling 
 You have worked with big data solutions like Redshift, Snowflake, Hadoop or Hive 
 Experience with realtime data streaming infrastructure like AWS Kinesis, Spark or Kafka 
 Worked with Cloud-based architecture such as AWS or Google Cloud 
 
Spin is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment in an unlawful matter. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all individuals. Spin treats all employees and job applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence without regard to any qualified individuals' sex, race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender (including pregnancy, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic characteristic or information, marital status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. Spin also considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable local, state, and federal law.
  
Spin is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in its job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at job_accommodations@spin.pm.
