 vor 13 Tagen

The Dyson business in Germany is growing rapidly, and so is the importance of making the most out of data, reporting, analytics and insight creation. Therefore, Business Intelligence will play a vital role in future proofing the business and leading the way in data-driven decision-making across all functions. The BI Analyst will help us to meet our great ambitions. 
Reporting into the Business Intelligence and Analytics Lead you will be the bridge between business and technical functions at Dyson in Germany. You will identify and develop key drivers of business performance, understanding end-to-end business processes and work out recommended actions while acting as an internal consultant to dedicated teams. At the same time, you will be responsible for handling monitoring and conduct ad-hoc and deep dive business analysis as well as assisting in planning processes. Working closely with data analysts you will use your deep understanding of the business to assist in developing data solutions and products that will improve data availability and cleanliness, be used for report and dashboard building as well as for other forms of data visualisations to support data-driven management decisions, improve data literacy and extract insights for the business. 
Joining our growing German BI team will offer you many opportunities for personal and professional growth and to become part of an ever-growing global BI and Analytics Community within Dyson. 
     Accountabilities  
  Acting as internal consultant and business partner to dedicated team/function as well as bridge between business and technical  
Understanding business processes, identify key drivers of business performance and work out recommendations for improvements and efficiency gains as well as spotting trends and opportunities  
Conduct deep dive and ad-hoc analysis, investigating specific issues using data and insights from multiple sources and business functions  
Assistance in business planning, forecasting as well as strategic planning  
Own ongoing internal reporting and monitoring processes, reporting on current business results with focus on providing context to multiple stakeholders and assisting in finding solutions and improvements  
Presentation of data, insights and recommendations to stakeholders and the wider business  
Support or lead on continuous iterative improvement processes for data solutions and products by utilizing deep understanding of business needs in collaboration with data analysts  
Work with analysts from different parts of the business to align on targets, data sources and visualisations, working towards one source of truth inside the business   
      Skills  
  University degree in Economics or other business/analytical discipline  
Previous first experience in an analytics or consulting role  
Very good Excel skills  
First experience in data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, DataStudio or similar BI tools  
Basic SQL skills and first experience in other statistical programming languages such as R or Python a benefit  
Strong strategic and analytical skills with attention to detail and the ability to identify new opportunities  
Ability to distil complex analytics into simple themes that are appropriate for non-technical stakeholders  
Excellent communication and presentation skills at all stakeholder levels  
Confident with the ability to work proactively and autonomously  
Enjoys working in a fast paced & ever-changing environment  
Fluent in German and English   
    Benefits  
  30 days holiday  
Flexible working hours  
work@home  
Pension scheme  
Company bonus scheme  
24/7 accident insurance  
Relaxed dress-code  
Subsidized sport activities  
Free on-site parking or subsidized job ticket  
Discount on Dyson machines and Corporate Benefits  
Fruits, coffee, tea, water, snackbox and ice cream  
Christmas and summer parties, Carnival

Wir verbinden täglich Millionen von Usern miteinander und sind 100% "Made in Germany".
 Tools
 SAS
 R
 Google Analytics
 SQL
 Tableau
 Gehalt
 90K EUR - 100 K EUR
  
Mein Kunde gilt als einer der digitalen Aushängeschilder „Made in Germany“ und erreicht täglich Millionen von Usern mit seinen maßgeschneiderten Produkten. Als digitaler Player sieht man hier im Unternehmen Technologie und Fortschritt als Grundstein für Vorsprung und Produkterfolg. In diesem Sinne wird menschliche und technologische Innovation als Unternehmenskultur gelebt.
  
Im Innovation Lab werden die Produkt von morgen schon heute gebaut und getestet. In diesem Zusammenhang sucht man Kunde einen Teamlead, welcher die Mischung aus operativer und strategischer Energie bündelt und ein Team um sich herum aufbaut und fördert. Es erwarten Sie „Cutting Edge“ Technologien und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld, welches Homeoffice und Int. Konferenzen fördert und schätzt.
  
Wenn Sie lust haben zu einem der innovativsten Arbeitgebern in Deutschland zu wechseln dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt.
  
Aufgaben
  
Du hast das „Big Picture“ im Blick. Was dir erlaubt deine Truppe optimal auszurichten um somit gemeinsam den größtmöglichen Beitrag zur optimalen und schnellen Entwicklung des Innovations Labs Beizutragen.
  
Als Teamlead übernimmst du die disziplinarische Verantwortung für das im Business Unit eingegliedertes Analytics Team und baust es weiter aus.
  
Du lenkst die fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung gemessen am Potentials deiner einzelnen Mitarbeiter.
  
Du leitest eigene Projekte, bist aber zugleich essenzieller Sparringspartner für die Business Analysten in ihrem Team.
  
Basierend auf deinen Analysen führst du und deine Truppe relevante Handlungsempfehlungen ab und setzt diese gemeinsam mit der Produktentwicklung und dem Marketing um.
  
In der Schnittstellenfunktion koordiniert du die Anforderungen zwischen dem Business Analytics Team und den anderen Abteilungen.
  
Profil
  
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Master Studium der Wirtschaft/ Sozialwissenschaft/Mathematik/Informatik mit starkem analytischen Fokus.
  
Du kannst mehrjährige Erfahrunge in den Bereichen Data- Mining, analytisches CRM und in der multivariaten Statistik vorweisen und kennst dich in der Webanalyse und dem A/B Testing aus.
  
Du hast bereits erfolgreich mit relevanten Tools (SAS, SPSS, R, Stata o.ä.) und großen Datenmengen hantiert und bringst dazu noch „Know How“ in SQL mit.

About us
    Founded in 2013 in Cologne, Fitogram is a well funded startup that provides software solution for thousands of fitness professionals across Europe. Our software helps managing services such as online booking, customer management, payments and accounting. We take pride in building software enjoyable to use.  
Our multinational, enthusiastic and lively team awaits you in the heart of Cologne. Let’s revolutionize the sports market together! 
     About the role
    We are looking for a  Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d ) who will be an essential part of our international team and will have the possibility to learn in a fast growing start-up environment in the heart of Cologne.
     Your tasks  
     You provide business-critical insights using analytics, ensure cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and help teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward.    
You stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early-stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.    
You will use an analytical, data-driven approach to drive a deep understanding of our fast-changing business, provide insights that will translate directly to accelerated business growth, and improve the ability of Fitogram to operate at scale while simultaneously delighting our customers.    
Additionally, you will partner with our cross-functional teams to identify the insights and intelligence they require to understand, manage, and grow their projects and develop solutions to deliver their requirements at scale.    
In this role, you will also provide analytical thought leadership to our leaders, delivering insights that enable them to make sound decisions about where to invest Product, Sales, and Marketing efforts.   
      Requirements  
     You have at least one year of working experience as an analyst or in a data team    
You are a good communicator and enjoy supporting others with data    
You enjoy learning and are willing to actively invest time towards your professional development    
You are interested in data science and are passionate about applying it to real life    
Any programming experience is a plus   
      What you can expect from us  
     The opportunity to steer the data usage of Fitogram    
Working with a highly motivated and international data team with the standard open source stack (sql, python, docker, airflow, metabase) in an agile process    
Data science in action and the chance to conduct advanced analyses to drive business    
Knowledge sharing and learning opportunities in an open data culture    
A flat hierarchy that offers a lot of self-responsibility, as well as opportunities for you to evolve and shape the company    
Regular team events, free drinks and snacks    
An Urban Sports Club L-Membership

We are home24, the leading home & living e-commerce platform in continental Europe and Brazil. We are currently active in eight countries and in 2018, we became a publicly listed company in Germany. Over 1,000 Homies work together towards a common goal: to create happy homes for everyone and every budget.    
 
How can we reach this goal? With an assortment of over 100,000 pieces of furniture and accessories from more than 500 suppliers, we offer the perfect addition to any living space combined with the comfort of being able to shop from anywhere.    
 
What makes us proud to be Homies? We are pioneers in our market who seamlessly combine technology and creativity. We utilize data to provide personalized recommendations, tips and inspiration for every home.    
 
At home24, we strive to deliver a superior assortment of products and the best service. To do this, we need fresh ideas, 100% motivation, and dedication to our company mission. We always have a space at our table for service-minded individuals who are passionate about digitization and modern living.   
For us to continue this growth and our mission, we are looking for you as our new:    
  
(Senior) Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d)    
Your     Responsibilities    
You will take over full ownership of your area end to end: from collecting requirements, designing multivariate tests, data mining, audiencing and conducting analyses  
Work closely with MarTech engineering team to identify and answer important product questions: product ranking, product recommendations, Search, etc...  
Help building a marketing steering Tool internally & automate bid adjustments  
Manage and control the entire flow of information within Marketing via Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics and internal DWH (AWS based).  
Analyze and interpret the results of product experiments & communicate findings to product managers and engineers     
  
Your     Profile    
BS/MS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Econometrics or related field  
You have experience in a WBA / MBI / product Analytics role using Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager or similar Measurement technologies  
Experience with recommendation, personalization, classification and/or scoring problems  
You are comfortable working with large data sets and analyzing complex data with SQL and other languages such as Python or R. Experience with Tableau/ Looker is a plus  
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner  
Good understanding of web languages and technology, eg HTML, Javascript, CSS, etc     
  
What we offer you    
The chance to make an impact  
The opportunity to work alongside a highly motivated team of professionals  
An open-minded culture ready to incorporate new and creative ideas  
Room for growth and development within your role and within the company  
Benefits including employee discounts on our entire assortment, team events, free fruit and drinks, German language classes and more!     
 
If you want to become part of a thrilling success story – we are looking forward to your application. Please send us your CV, cover letter and all relevant documents together with your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date via Jobvite.    
 
Your home is surely filled with furniture of varying materials and styles. The same is true for home24 as an employer. We celebrate the diversity of the people who work with us. Be who you are and feel welcome to #makeyourselfathome24   
home24 SE | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Joao Mingote

SAP Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst/ GFEBS   (  PEN001746  )  
    
Description    
   This position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.    
  
  POSITION SUMMARY:   
     Responsible to ensure all data in General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS) is entered and processed correctly. Generates all reports and contract deliverables in GFEBS IAW Vectrus requirements and contract Performance Work Statement (PWS). Shall routinely generate GFEBS reports and analyze data for compliance, accuracy and duplication.  
  
  MAJOR JOB ACTIVITIES:  .
     Create large sets of organization data related to all contractual and maintenance tasks.    
Work in conjunction with the Preventive Maintenance (PM) Manager to ensure all pertinent data is collected in GFEBS; ensure all task employees understand the data to be entered and how to enter the data properly.    
Must perform in-depth analysis of maintenance data, financial data and work order data, create reports and manage and store data to report contract status (includes customer, suppliers, invoices, equipment, etc.) and provides explanation of results to higher commands    
Requires a significant amount of data analysis experience (must know GFEBS in depth)    
Detailed knowledge of GFEBS for O&M tasks as well as financial, work order tracking and material management.    
    MATERIAL & EQUIPMENT DIRECTLY USED:  
 Advanced level of experience with MS Office systems, with expert level emphasis on MS Excel data analysis. 
  WORKING ENVIRONMENT:  
   The working environment is in an office location; in some instances, may need to visit different work site locations. All job duties will include performing the requirements under time and resources constraints, and in difficult surroundings.

Aufgaben
  
In dieser Rolle unterstützen Sie konzernweit die Geschäftsbereiche, HR-Abteilungen und die Vorstandsebene mit der Bereitstellung einer HR-fachlichen Analyse- und Reportingplattform und Analyse der Daten.
  
 
 Sie verantworten den Betrieb unseres HR-BI-Systems auf Basis von SAP-HCM und IBM Planning Analytics (ehem. Cognos TM1). 
 Sie stellen fundierte Berichte und Standardreportings für das Management und die operativen Bereiche bereit. 
 Sie erheben HR-Kennzahlen, analysieren Planabweichungen und stimmen Auffälligkeiten mit den entsprechenden Stakeholdern ab. 
 Sie bilden die Schnittstelle zu den HR-Businessbereichen, zum Rechnungswesen, dem Controlling, Payroll und der IT. 
 Sie wirken am Personalplanungsprozess (Personalbedarfs-, Nachfolge- und Personalkosten-planung) sowie den unterjährigen Forecasts mit. 
 
Qualifikationen
  
Für diese Aufgabe bringen Sie ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften bzw. eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit. Darüber hinaus besitzen Sie mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Position im internationalen Umfeld. Sie haben Freude an der Arbeit mit Technologie und Zahlen und die Motivation, Themen weiterzuentwickeln
  
 
 Sie haben Erfahrung in der Administration eines BI-Systems und kennen sich in SQL und VBA aus. 
 Sie können sicher und souverän mit MS Excel und MS Access umgehen und besitzen professionelle Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von SAP (HCM, CO und FI). 
 Sie haben Erfahrung in der Erstellung von HR-fachlichen Reports, Berichten und Ad-hoc-Auswertungen und besitzen darüber hinaus Kenntnisse in der Durchführung von Personalplanungen. 
 Sie sind in der Lage, Ergebnisse Ihrer Analysen, mögliche Abweichungen und auch komplexe HR Kennzahlen verständlich zu erläutern. 
 Sie kommunizieren auf allen Hierarchieebenen in Deutsch und Englisch sicher und selbstbewusst.

 vor 30+ Tagen

Beschreibung  
 At Personio we are on the amazing journey of becoming the leading HR Platform in Europe! 
 
Join our international Business Intelligence team and take an active role in shaping our culture and the future of our organization. 
You will be responsible for building and improving analytical solutions to drive decision-making and generation of valuable insights for Personio and its departments. Your ideas and insights will shape Personio’s strategy as we are building Europe’s leading one-stop HR platform. If you’re passionate about delivering high quality data solutions, and enjoy a fast paced diverse working environment, Personio is the place for you! 
 
 Your tasks and responsibilities will include:  
  
Being the expert and point of contact for all BI-driven reporting and analytics solutions for Sales within Personio  
Creating and continuously improving dashboards and reportings on critical Sales-KPIs to support better decision making for further growth  
Proactively identifying and discussing stakeholder requirements, and groom them into deliverables  
Constructing data models that enable self-service exploration of relevant data for stakeholders  
Disseminating self-service analytics capabilities into the Sales team and providing end-user training on visualization tools, dashboards and data models  
Ensuring continuity for all Sales reporting solutions as sales and BI transition to new tools  
     Dein Profil  
   At least 5 years of work experience in a business intelligence, data science or other BI-related field, preferably with an emphasis on sales, ideally in B2B software environment  
Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving and manipulating data, and profound skills in Python  
Experience with constructing and maintaining ETL processes is a plus  
Experienced in data analysis and visualisation, ideally with Sisense, Periscope or comparable data visualization tools  
Proactive attitude in identifying and implementing solutions  
Great communication skills, detail-orientation and high standards on data quality  
Salesforce experience or understanding of underlying data model is a plus  
You are business-fluent in English (Level C1/C2), German is a plus  
     Warum Personio  
   Market-proven, well-funded and fast growing company ($54.3M funding acquired to date)  
Your chance to play a decisive role in shaping Personio and have a direct impact on the daily work of hundreds of thousands of users  
1.500 EUR of development budget per year for attending conferences, courses, buying books  
MacBook Pro and gadgets, including BOSE headsets with noise cancellation  
28 paid vacation days, at least 3 days of home office per month, and flexible working hours  
Unu electric scooter of your choice as "company car" (see www.unumotors.com) or an additional payment for a yearly public transportation ticket  
Subsidized Qualitrain membership: For 25 euros a month you can train in 90 fitness and yoga studios, swimming pools and many other sports facilities in Munich  
Relocation and visa support through an expert agency to Munich, Germany  
Weekly German language courses  
Regular team and company events (e.g. Oktoberfest in Munich and skiing trip to Austria)  
Because joining us at an early stage shows your trust and confidence in Personio, we want you to also profit from the success of the company. Therefore, we will offer you a competitive compensation package (e.g. salary, benefits, virtual shares)  
     Über uns  
 Teil Personios zu sein bedeutet, du bist Teil von etwas Großem. Es bedeutet, die HR-Zukunft zu gestalten, die Zukunft unseres Unternehmens und gleichzeitig: deine eigene. Als eines der am schnellsten wachsenden B2B-SaaS-Unternehmen in Europa haben wir ein großartiges Produkt, ein ambitioniertes Team von mehr als 300 Kollegen und einen Markt, der nur darauf wartet, entwickelt zu werden. Mittlerweile arbeiten mehr als 2000 Unternehmen mit Personio, doch das ist für uns erst der Anfang: Unser Ziel ist es, die führende HR-Plattform in Europa aufzubauen. Bei Personio glauben wir an Menschen wie dich - ehrgeizige, zukunftsorientierte Talente, die mehr sein wollen als nur ein weiterer Mitarbeiter. Bist du dabei?      
 Personio GmbH   -
